column1: length ball, arrowed in towards the pads, Cook jabs it down to the leg side
full, in the channel, ducking and darting like a red snapper, left alone as it nips away
pitched up, slightly wobbly seam as Cook moves across into line and defends back towards the bowler
good pace from Starc, sharp on off stump but Cook drops is bat and prods to backward point
good lines from Starc, touch full on off stump and defended solidly once more

rising off a length in the corridor, into Tim Paine's gloves as Cook comes forward and leaves, seeing out the 1,085,046th* maiden of his long Test career

*approx
angled across from over the wicket, good length and left alone
oh, big shout for lbw second ball to Stoneman, caught falling across his stumps... pitched outside leg? Umpire Marais Erasmus shakes his head. There was certainly some inswing for Hazlewood
full and gets him on the front foot, Stoneman clouts a drive straight to cover
pitched up and met with a solid blade, along the carpet to mid-off
middled! Hazlewood offers some width and Stoneman climbs into it with alacrity, stepping out to clatter the first runs to the deep cover fence
good length, 143kph and a better line outside off, Stoneman leaves
good length, shaping on off at 142kph and defended
touch straighter from Starc, 145kph but nudged calmly to leg for Cook's first run of the day

blimey, that's a beaut of a ball! No chance of Stoneman getting anything on that, fired in and then seaming, rising like a hellbeast from the deep, past the outside edge as the batsman is completely squared up
flings this on to the pads and Stoneman clips it fine, runs away for four
four more, Stoneman clubs past square leg... Starc seems to be striving for the lbw but he's been put away a couple of times, as happened in the second innings at Adelaide
and another, crumped through point! Confident stuff from Stoneman, who lashes it square coming forwards. Adrenalin pumping
banged in on a length and left alone outside off
length on off, 143kph but Cook covers it and shows a straight bat
full and driven, Cook to the gun show now! The ball races away across the WACA outfield as he rolls out the cover drive, David Warner unsuccessful in his attempts to chase it down... Nicely done
comes across and jabs the ball down square
full, fading in and punched without much timing towards mid-on
oof, beats him with the final delivery, that's shot through past the edge as Cook is caught in no-man's land
pitched up and driven again, picks up a couple through backward point
fired in straight and tucked away for one to deep square leg
full, 146kph from Starc, Cook nearly loses his footing but squirts away a glance wide of fine leg for two more

full and fast, 149kph and trapped in front! No review from Cook, he knows that was plumb... Starc finds his line and sends a searing attempted yorker into the pads, no big innings for Cook in his 150th Test (at least for now); too slow to get the bat down and his lean series continues
pitched up, full and tempting in the corridor, left alone
closer to off stump, 146kph and zipping through as Vince again leans out and watchfully shoulders arms
round the wicket to Stoneman, good carry in the channel as he comes across and leaves, maybe a touch short
this is closer to the full length he's after, 143kph outside off, left again
nasty bouncer, that's surprised Stoneman... but it lands safely as he fends towards square leg! No close catcher in but that really discomfited him
over the wicket, touch back of a length, 139kph and defended
fuller, 144kph and Vince gets forward, punched without timing to mid-off
comes across on off and steers a length ball towards backward point

dug in short, Stoneman takes his bottom hand off as he fends and keeps the ball down... and this has actually broken his bat handle! That's the second stick of Stoneman's that has needed replacing in this series
sliding down the leg side as Stoneman flicks at it

banged in, rising towards the eyeline, jabbed in the air towards point - but it falls short again! That came flying off the shoulder of the bat, no idea where it was going. Stoneman being given a torrid working over here
bosh, he lands a blow in return! Pitched up but he's quick to come forward and crunches a drive through mid-on
short again, this time he fences it into the leg side for one
short and flying through as Vince sways out of the way
fullish, comes across and defends
dug in, spitting off the pitch and Stoneman throws the hands up again, the ball thudding into the shoulder of the bat and landing short of backward point - very similar to the Starc over
back of a length, rising towards the body, tapped down safely
fuller, too straight from Hazlewood and Stoneman rifles it past the close catcher, right out of the screws and he picks up another boundary
touch short, 140kph and flying through as he brings the bat inside the line - played it pretty well
short of a length in the corridor outside off and left alone
good length outside off, Vince moves into line and leaves it alone
fuller, angled in and clipped off the pads, excellent diving stop from midwicket prevents four
around off stump, 140kph and pitched up, Vince defends
tight line, length delivery but it's well judged and left alone

pitched up and caressed through the covers, Vince picks up his first runs with a cover-driven (what else?) four... Lovely stroke, using 142 clicks to his advantage and piercing the infield, it races away
length, fourth-stump line, again Vince isn't drawn into playin
ooh, jabbed in the air again, manages to keep this down in front of backward point
Hazlewood is hitting his straps here, 143kph bouncer, whistling through past the lugholes as Stoneman jerks out of the way
oof, close to a bat-pad catch, length ball and it takes the inside edge, deflects down short of the man under the helmet
touch back of a length and plinked into the covers off the toe of the bat, they scamper through
pitched up, 140kph and defended in front of off stump
full, straight and skelped through midwicket for four more! Vince whips the ball off his legs, keeps the old WACA scoreboard rattling along
nicely bowled, gets Stoneman feeling for it as the ball climbs on off stump, edged low towards the cordon
drop and run, Stoneman plays softly and steers a single square
banged in, bumper to Vince who shrugs his shoulders and gets out of the way - slightly too leg side
short and cut, latches on to it and makes a solid connection but sends the ball straight to point
fired in straighter, clipped off the inside edge on to the pads
attacking the stumps, Vince isn't quite so comfortable playing this but he manages to poke it away to safety
fullish length, sliding into the pads, worked in front of square without timing
banged in, 139kph and fizzing over the shoulder as Stoneman ducks the challenge
pitched up and punched back to the bowler, Starc shapes to throw as he fields in his follow through
full and driven through the covers, not the cleanest of connections but he gets a couple more
short, that's an awkward length, Stoneman gets in a bit of a tangle once again but manages to drop the ball at his feet

bouncer, wide of off stump, Stoneman ignores it and Paine couldn't lay a glove on the ball either - the WACA bounce of old, four byes bringing up the England 50 to contented Barmy Army gurgles around the ground
pitched up and neatly dabbed into a gap coming forwards for one
full of a length, Stoneman is forward again and clipping through the covers
shuffles across and lets the ball go
ripping ball, jagging back in to thump the pads, stifled appeal from Cummins... Did he hit it? Maybe high, too, and Australia don't chance a review
left on length, flying over off stump as Vince shoulders arms

overpitched and lashed square, England's tenth boundary of the morning as Vince leans out and opens the face -
 getting full value for them
dug in short and outside off, Stoneman throws his hands at the ball, and watches it zip past the outside edge
whoa, great grab from Paine behind the stumps. He throws himself to his right and snaffles it with one hand. Starc veers down the leg side
excellent short ball from Starc, shoulder-high delivery just outside off, Stoneman has his eyed locked on it before swaying his upper body out of the way
Starc stays into the pads, picked off easily through square leg
really full on off stump, Vince jabs his bat down and squeezes out a drive through the covers, and Vince secures three, despite a direct hit
Stoneman gets on top of this short delivery outside off and punches to backward point
back of a length and Cummins explores the channel outside off, ignored
good length, starts outside off, and seams back in to graze the inside edge and wander away into the vacant spaces at square leg
bouncer, angling in, 144.2ks, Stoneman ducks under it as the ball sails over to Paine
back of a length and heading towards the top of off from around the wicket, patted to cover point
slinging in at the top of off, pushed to mid-off
Stone opens the face and guides this from outside off to backward point
very full and slanting into leg stump, Vince falls over the flick and wears it on the pad
chest-hunting short ball on middle, Vince rides the bounce and deflects it towards long leg. Played, Vince
just short of a good length and arrowed in at the top of off, back-foot punch to mid-on
another cracker from Starc. Gee, look at the bounce. Back of a length and fizzes through the corridor, Starc lures the batsman into a meek waft away from the body
much tighter from Stoneman. 146.6ks short ball slammed outside off, Stoneman carefully sways his upper body out of the way
back of a length and on a fourth-stump line, Stoneman rides the bounce and guides it to backward point
pretty full and jabs in on off, Vince does not middle the cover drive as the ball streaks away to the midwicket region off the inside edge
rising short ball outside off, Stoneman rises with it and pats it down like a gambolling puppy
good length and angling into a solid forward-defensive
shot, Stoneman! Overpitched outside off, 146.6ks, Stoneman employs a short stride and drills it past the right of the bowler. Sublime timing
Cummins responds with a bouncer, aimed at the head, the batsman sinks under it
whoa! This one bursts from a back of a length outside off, Stoneman does well enough to tuck his bat inside the line
142ks yorker, hurtling through outside off, Vince jabs his bat down. Nearly feathers it behind to the keeper
pitched up further and attacking off stump, Vince's forward-defensive intervenes
back of a length and outside off, left alone
back of a length and straight in line, tucked to midwicket
lifter down leg, soars over the ducking batsman, soars past the left of a leaping Paine. Wide
good length on middle, Vince answers with a straight bat
slid through on a fourth-stump line, blocked off the front foot
dangled up on middle, not much turn, Stoneman dares to attack Lyon with a sweep. He ends up shovelling it to long leg
Vince aims to attack Lyon too. He dances out and clips this shortish ball past midwicket
Stoneman has another biiiig swing at a sweep, not middled as the ball streaks to long leg
fired on middle, down the track and eased down to long-on
slower through the air on middle, no turn again, dead batted
nice and full outside off, patted towards point
full and probing away outside off, left alone in the channel
bouncer outside off, Vince lets it sail through to the keeper
pitched up and nibbling through outside off, will Vince have a nibble at it? Nope
good length and excellent carry through to the keeper outside off, ignored
good length and angling into a solid defence
loopier and on off, played back to Lyon
Stoneman skips out and chips it against the break wide of mid-on
angling away around off, good length, Vince defends it back to him
Lyon slides it into the pads, worked away.... Bancroft dives to his right from short leg and intercepts it
booooooming drive from Vince. Again, he uses his feet. Full and angling across off, he meets the pitch and crunches it through extra cover
back of a length on off, defended back to the bowler
around the wicket and drifting into the pads, deflected to long leg
back of a length and outside off, ignored
Hazlewood hammers one into the middle of the deck and gets it to fly over a half-ducking Vince to Paine
good length and angling into a tight forward-defensive
good length and he keeps attacking the stumps, Vince blocks with soft hands
much fuller than a good length and put outside off, Vince shelves his favourite cover drive and lets it pass
tossed-up offbreak, starts outside off and turns away, defended to cover off the front foot
Stoneman swings his hands at another sweep - this one is launched over square leg. He goes low and nails the slog sweep from the stumps
eased through the covers now
here comes Vince, down the track. Lyon goes shorter on middle, whipped to midwicket
Vince uses his feet again, this is slid through short and flat on off. Quietly played back
slower and drifts in on middle, Vince stays still and blocks to short leg
darted onto the hips, he can't make contact with a flick. The ball hits the thigh and trickles down to fine leg
good length and angling in towards off, angled to gully with soft hands
good change-up from Hazlewood - shorter and outside off. Vince arches his back and lets it go
Hazlewood ventures wide of the crease and slants it in just outside off, no shot
follows the fuller one with another bouncer, Vince does not go after it
full and angling in at off and middle, stylishly flicked to short midwicket
good length and drifting in on middle, Stoneman goes back and drops it into the off side
on a length and breaks away outside off, tapped with the turn to backward point
Not yet... Pushed through on off, quietly played back to Lyon
faster and skidding in to graze the inside edge and roll down to forward short leg
shorter offbreak outside off, Stoneman rides the bounce and chops it down to backward point

tossed up outside off and drifts into the left-hander, Stoneman pops it in the air... but just wide of Bancroft at short leg. The ball hits Bancroft's right boot and sneaks away. These ones stick or they don't. Simple
back of a length and angling into middle, defended back
much fuller and slanting in on off, 140.1ks, played back to the bowler again

There's the (fatal) cover drive from Vince and he nicks it off with six minutes to go for lunch. Good length and hung up outside off, Vince can't restrain himself from having a crack at it. He wafts away from the body and feathers it behind to Paine. Vince loses his patience, Hazlewood reaps reward for keeping his patience
full and zipping through outside off, 147ks, left alone
another full tempter, bends back in sharply from outside off, finishes just outside off, Root isn't tempted
bouncer on middle, ducks under it. Hazlewood has four maidens and a wicket in his last four overs
dangled up just outside off, defended off the front foot
length-ball slider outside off, Stoneman negotiates it off the front foot
dropped short and wide outside off - ripe for the cut - chopped to sweeper
tossed up and turns in on middle, nudged with the break to square leg
lobbed up on off, played back to Lyon
shorter offbreak on off, hint of turn for Lyon, defended with soft hands in the direction of backward point
pitched up first ball and Root picks up a boundary with a sliced drive through backward point. Hazlewood won't mind that too much
good length, 138kph and close to off stump, lets the ball pass through
fired in straighter, aiming for Root's pads, they've got him out a couple of times like that... but this is slapped away wide of fine leg, just the one as Stoneman is sent back thinking of a second
round the wicket, 144kph and banged on a hard length, clips the inside edge and rolls away
short and wide, Stoneman flings the furniture at a cut but sees the ball trampoline over his top edge and into the keeper's gloves
banged in and flashed high over backward point, he's connected with this one, a lusty spank for four - and that's Stoneman's fifty, his second of the series. Can he go on?
runs in and hits the middle of the pitch, Root ducks the bouncer
touch short, 139kph outside off and Root is well in control of a back-foot dab through the covers for a couple
comes across and defends around off

pitched up, again looking for the lbw, Root doesn't miss out and swooshes a clip through midwicket, the ball sucked to the rope by the 'Perth vacuum', as He Who Shall Not Be Named puts it on TV commentary
touch shot outside off and left alone hanging back in the crease
short and drilled through backward point, Root rides the bounce and sends a rasping punch in front of the diving Khawaja and away for four more
pitched up, around the front pad again, Root blocks securely
Stoneman gets into line and defends on off stump
bowing round the wicket to Stoneman, banged in short and he sways out of the way
another bumper, over middle and off as Stoneman leans back and lets it through once more

pitched up, Stoneman drives, big fat edge... but it's shelled by Mitchell Marsh at first slip! Groans from the crowd as the replay is shown on the screen, it seemed to take an age to get to Marsh, as he put the hands up in preparation, only for it to burst through and scuttle away, chance gone
length outside off, Stoneman goes back to watchful defence
straighter line, stays back and works the ball down in front of short leg
runs flowing for England, and they're off Nelson... Root opens the face and glides four past third slip
shortish around off, defended
back of a length over the stumps, dabbed down to the off side
plants the front foot and defends, 144kph on a good length outside off
ooh, feisty bumper from Cummins, has him in a moment's difficulty, Root takes the blow on the gloves but is alert and looking for the single before square leg runs in to prevent one
on the pads and clipped towards miwidwicket, quickly tidied up in the field

short ball, at the batsman - takes the blow on the side of the helmet! Yowch, that's going to leave a ringing in the ears, though Stoneman is able to walk away and take off his lid unaided. The stem-guards popped off, as they often do, but the protective gear absorbed most of the impact, I think

banged in, helluva ball for Stoneman to face straight after that blow to the head, he fends into the air... but now Lyon drops it leaping forwards from point! Really tough chance coming in as the ball died but he got the hands there, couldn't hold on!
length outside off, 144kph and defened. Steady
dug in, a genuine bouncer, flying through as Stoneman weaves out of the way
ooh, beaten again, feeling for a drive to a ball that wasn't quite full enough
aiming for the top of off, 146kph as Hazlewood feels the WACA juju crackle through him, stoutly blocked to see out a snorting over
touch back of a length around off, Root defends calmly
comes across and taps into the off side, defusing some of the tension
good length, around off stump and defended

gottim, tickled down the leg side! Root fails to calm the roiling waters as Cummins gets him again, 146kph and it just flicks the gloves on its way through as he looked to turn off his hip! What a way to go, a huge breakthrough for Australia
round the wicket, hits a length and Malan defends
yeesh, that's practically turned Malan into a pretzel! Short and rearing at the throat as he jerks the head out of the way, almost bending over backwards to evade it
yip, beats the bat again! Good length and rising sharply as it holds its line, Stoneman not quite committing
dug in, 138kph and this time he ducks successfully
well played, not much foot movement but he opens the face and adroitly guides the ball past backward point - picks up four, and goes on to his highest Test score
short ball, well directed and he takes his eye off it, eventually takes it on the glove and the ball drops safely to his feet. Testing stuff, this
flying through again as Stoneman props forward! Nipped away a fraction at 143kph as he pushes and is beaten
another rapid bumper to finish, this time he manages to get his head and body out of the firing line
fiery short delivery from Cummins, coming back at him from round the wicket, again he sways away
length, heading on to the legs but it falls down short off the padding
comes across and defends, solidly into line
short and down the leg side, Cummins likes it, Australia go up for another catch off the glove... but Erasmus shakes his head, looks like it flicked the trouser pocket
Malan comes across and then limbos out of the way of another short delivery
pitched up and driven, crisply struck through the covers for Malan's first runs, though Warner gives hectic chase and slides to pull it in short of the rope
over the wicket, puts it on a length outside off and Malan watches it through
comes forward, blocked on off
dug in, 142kph and punched away, taken on the bounce by short leg! Malan survives, back in his crease and fending off the bouncer, Bancroft threw himself forward but couldn't quite get there
good pace and bounce in the channel, lets this one go
on the pads, 144kph but Malan uses the pace and skims it away to fine leg for a gimme four
four more, slashed over the slips! Malan flashes hard and gets the reward, there was just a wide slip in but it was well beyond his reach
back of a length outside off and defended towards point
they keep coming, 142kph around a fourth-stump line, blocked towards mid-off
banged in short and veering down the leg side, Paine leaps across to his right
another decent bumper, Stoneman ducks
back of a length on the stumps, punched towards mid-on
over the wicket now, dug in and rising towards the ribcage as Stoneman drops back and defends
comes across and nurdles into a gap on the leg side off the inside edge
short, sliding down the leg side, flick and a miss
short, over the stumps, tapped down back towards the bowler
angled in with the arm, 146kph and tucked to the leg side from back in the crease

ripping bouncer, Stoneman throws up the hands and is beaten... or is he? No, there was a flick of glove on it! Paine took a leaping catch and Australia quickly reviewed Erasmus' not-out decision, with Aleem Dar determining that a ripple on Snicko was evidence of contact. Erasmus has to reverse the call and up goes the finger, Stoneman's gutsy knock is over! That was a snorter, unlucky for the batsmen on several levels
back of a length, leans back and lets it fly through at chest height
short of a length but slightly wide and Malan leaves
banged in and Malan pulls unconvincingly, the ball squirming away wide of the diving Paine... actually came off the helmet, I think, though given as runs
length on off and defended from the crease
dug in short again, this is pulled away down to deep backward square
in the channel, YJB gets into line and leaves alone
short, Bairstow rocks out of the way of the bumper
pitched up by Starc and Malan doesn't miss out, creaming a drive through the covers
around off stump, touch short of a good length and blocked

hammering the middle of the pitch, Malan takes it on, shout of 'catch!' as he clubs a pull towards deep midwicket, it was on him quickly but he managed to get the ball up and over into a gap for a couple
length on off, pushed towards cover
fullish, 143kph and Malan gets across his stumps to pat it away
short ball, swatted away down to fine leg for one
Cummins runs in hard, hits the deck harder, and gets it to soar over the attempted hook to slam the gloves of the keeper
these short stuff will keep both short leg and leg gully interested. Chest-high lifter on middle, Malan jumps off the ground and fends it wide of the man under the helmet
short but not enough width to free the arms, YJB chops it down towards backward point
Oooh, that's regal! This wasn't a half-volley - fuller than a good length and outside off - he takes it on the up and drives it through the line past mid-off
Cummins responds with an angry, nasty bouncer, YJB deals with it well. Sways his upper body out of the way
another zippy bouncer outside off, YJB arches his back and lets it go
Australia keep peppering these batsmen with the short stuff, Malan ducks under it
banged in short and slating away outside off, Malan dares to hook against the angle. But he is rushed for pace and sends a top edge flying over the keeper's head for a six
short of a length and skidding away outside off, Malan now opts to sway his upper body out of the way
back of a length and angling across off, left alone
proper bouncer, zipping across off, Malan evades it
chest-high short ball, 145ks on middle, Malan takes it on with a hook. Ends up mis-hitting it down to long leg
sliding in with the arm, blocked
pushed through on middle, shimmies out and quietly defends it back
tossed up and drifts in to beat the sweep and hit the pad outside the line of off
shorter offbreak outside off, turns away, Malan does not get on top of the bounce and chops to backward point
Malan uses his feet, this grips and turns, check-pushed to the covers
tossed on off, Malan employs a big stride and taps to cover
keeps it short, angling across off, left alone
much fuller on off stump, YJB presses forward in defence
really full and sprayed down the leg side, there's a deflection - but it's off the thigh pad to Paine. Steven Smith is very animated but there's no bat involved here

A direct hit could have had Malan at the striker's end. Warner swoops down on the ball at short cover but fails to throw the stumps down. Back of a length on off, tip and run. Risky... and England get away
short and slinging away outside off, no shot. Starc spices things up with some verbal volleys too
back of a length and on the thigh, 144ks, Starc has Malan hopping, skipping, and fending off to short leg
tossed on off from around the wicket, YJB stretches out and punches drives it to the right of mid-off. Excellent timing and placement to boot
pushed through quicker on middle, defended back
Lyon flies to his left but the ball evades his reach. Pushed through, angling across off, some overspin, scoops a drive past the diving bowler. Lyon can't quite replicate his Adelaide heroics yet
tossed up, breaks in, inside-edged back down the pitch
flat on middle and leg, defended
sliced off an outside edge to backward point
good length and angling in on off, tapped back down the pitch
much fuller and on off, driven straight to mid-off off the front foot
there's the bouncer, on middle, the batsman yanks his head out of the way
short and on off, Hazlewood keeps pushing Malan back, run away to backward point with soft hands
back of a length and the line is wider outside off, ignored
bigger short ball, in fact a proper bouncer outside off, Malan evades it
full and sliding into middle and leg, worked into the vacant spaces at square leg
back of a length and on off, Malan is right behind it in defence
arm ball, fizzing in, defended off the back foot
Malan steps out, but this offbreak dips, creating distance between the bat and the pitch, wafted past the bowler
back of a length and too straight, tucked towards midwicket off the back foot
another one slides towards the stumps, blocked off the back foot
pretty full and straight, a whirl of the wrists sends the ball past midwicket's left
back of a length and angling into a solid forward defensive
just short of a good length on off, punched on the up to cover
tight line on off, YJB answers with a tighter defence
pitched up and outside off, forward and driven through the line to the left of mid-off
Bancroft throws himself to his right from short cover and intercepts this firm drive
tossed up on middle, defended back
back of a length and drifts in with some overspin, defended beside his feet
lobbed up on middle, dead batted
straighter one on middle, prodded to midwicket
Malan uses his feet and quietly defends a full one back to the bowler
flatter and skids into the left hander, played back again
just short of a good length on middle, YJB hangs back and fends it back
full-toss, angling into leg stump, clipped to deep square leg
full and wide outside off, Malan frees his arms and flashes a drive behind point
picked off the pads to deep midwicket
good length and holds its line outside off, left alone
good length and slanting across off, left alone again
flat dart outside off, no shot. YJB shelves the cut
slower through the air on off, defended off the front foot
shorter on off stump, punched into the covers
loopy offbreak on off, dead batted
Lyon finds extra bounce outside off, YJB lets another one go
starts just outside off and turns in, dead batted again
just short of a good length on off, prodded into the covers off the back foot
much fuller, angling away outside off, nearly kisses the outside edge through to the keeper
good length and pushed across off, left alone now
full on off, forward and driven to mid-off
good length and angling away outside off, too wide to draw a shot
full and straight, Marsh searches for some swing, but watches Malan whip it delectably past wide mid-on's left
nudged with the break behind square
shorter and turns away outside off, back-foot punch to cover
tossed on middle, driven smoothly to long-on
drifting in on middle, defended back to the bowler
sliding onto leg stump, forward and blocked back

Did the carry to Bancroft at forward short leg? The reactions of the Australian fielders suggest it probably din't. Tossed-up offbreak and dips on leg stump, this is a full-blooded flick from Malan. Bancroft, it seemed like, was make taking evasive action rather than going for the ball
slightly back of a length outside off, 134kph and Bairstow raises his bat out of the way
touch short again and this is chopped towards point on the back foot, 'wait on!' bellows YJB
comes across and defends on off
pitched up now, 139kph in the channel, not much in the way of lateral movement - although that's not what has caused most of the issues today - and left alone
fullish outside off and YJB leaves alone once more
slightly short from Cummins, gets into line of off and blocks
round the wicket, tossed up outside off
Malan uses the feet and pushes the right of the bowler, Lyon grabs it and fires in the throw as the batsman scrambles for his ground
drops a touch short, Malan goes back and slams a cut to backward point
tossed up and dinked down the ground on the front foot
flighted from over the wicket to the right-hander, turned down towards short leg
tossed up and met with a dogged front-foot block
round the wicket, 140kph on a good length, Malan shows it the maker's name and prods square
good length again, played with an open face and steered to backward point
Malan moves across on off stump and tapped towards backward point
full in the channel, Malan not tempted
Malan comes across to a 139kph delivery and squirts it into a gap at cover to keep the strike
pushed through, goes back on his stumps and defends
flighted from round the wicket, tucked to leg
uses the feet now and breaks the wrists the clip a single through the leg side
tossed up and jabbed past short leg, shout of 'catch!' from Lyon but not sure it carried and would have been an superb instinctive take if Bancroft had got there
short and cut, Malan makes room on the back foot and lashes the ball to deep backward point
tossed up and Malan punches back down the track again, Lyon grabs it
full and tailing in a fraction as Bairstow dinks a drive back to Cummins in his follow through
full again, on middle stump and driven, the bat turns in the hands slightly and the ball rolls to mid-on
YJB shifts across, makes a forward movement and then throws up his hands to allow the ball through
sliding and worked away through square leg for a couple, Bairstow head down and scurrying off straight away
oof, well-directed bouncer but it's well played, down on one knee and moving his head out of the way. Shades of the 'Judge', Robin Smith, smelling the leather on its way through
angled in and flicked fine for another single
flighted, staying round the wicket now, defended coming forwards
tossed up and he closes the face on this, briefly in the air towards mid-on
floated up, slightly too full and YJB clips it off his toes to deep midwicket
pushed through, bit of drop and Malan punches back to the bowler
tossed up on off, comes forward and prods a single through mid-off - that's the fifty, quick raise of the bat from Malan. Fourth time he's got there in Tests, England need him to convert this one
over the wicket, pushed through outside off and cut towards backward point
fullish but wide of the stumps and Malan leaves it be
oh, yes, I'll have a slice of that... overpitched by Cummins and the ball is larruped through the covers, despite some protection on that side, one of the shots of the day
tighter line and this time he defends
banged in, 139kph and rising as Malan stops, drops and rolls
good length, too wide from Cummins again, though
slightly full and defended into the off side as he comes across
pushed through wide of off stump and Bairstow leaves
pushed through, more overspin as he comes forward to defend
flighted, bit slower this time, goes back and taps to leg
on the stumps and clipped towards midwicket

tossed up and he drives against the spin, eased down the ground, wide of mid-off and Starc's slide fails to cut the ball off, it then outruns his second diving effort as he ends up eating boundary marker
full and flighted on the stumps, tapped away
round the wicket, back of a length and it hurries Malan as he plays across the line, hit on the thigh and it balloons towards point
fuller and prodded back to the on side
hurled down on off stump, 140kph... but he's overstepped, striving for that extra yard
goes full on off, maybe a touch of reverse swing but Malan covers it and clips stylishly towards mid-on, who dives to cut it off
good length around off stump, defended
fuller, sliding into the pads at 138kph and flicked through square to one of the sweepers
over the wicket, pitched up and steered to backward point with an open bat face
pitched up, hint of swing away, 139kph and driven into the ground, bobbling wide of cover for one
good length and shaping in to Bairstow, who blocks
this swirls away as he ploughs into the breeze, 137kph and left alone as it zips through to Paine
bangs in the bouncer, YJB crouches deep in his crease
on the pads, clipped unfussily down to fine leg, that raises the England 200 - well done, them
full in the channel, Malan chops down on a drive and they pick up two through cover
Hazlewood strays, this is meat and potatoes to most Test batsmen, he's standing outside leg and cracks it to the midwicket fence
pitched up on off and driven, they're aided by a misfield in stealing one
angled across on a shortish length, 140kph and defended towards backward point
back of a length on fourth-fifth stump and Malan lets it go
shuffles into line on off stumps and defends towards his toes
full and spanked, Malan threads the gap again, beats extra cover and mid-off won't catch that. Handsome stuff
round the wicket, good length on off, 140kph and defended
full outside off, YJB steps out to drive without timing to cover
dug in short, head-hunting bouncer but Bairstow is down out of the way
very full, 140kph and tailing away late as Bairstow holds himself from playing the drive, as he wanted to
and now Starc goes too straight and YJB gets his reward for abstinence to the previous ball, whipped off the pads and Cummins won't catch it
comes across his stumps and defends
Malan comes across and pushes to the on side
touch straight, worked into the leg side for a couple

back of a length, super ball and it's through him again - but did it kiss the edge? Paine's reaction was the giveaway, as he took a tumbling catch, looks like it flicked the back leg... Very similar to a couple of Malan's dismissals in the series so far against Cummins
gets into line on off and defends
short ball, at the body but Malan does well, thinks about playing but then gets out of the way
another bumper, this flies through at head height with Malan well down
back over the wicket, full and a touch wide, Bairstow chops down on a drive and it runs towards mid-off
full and he pings a drive into the covers, where Bancroft throws himself on it and prevents a run
slammed in short, 140kph but a touch leg side, ducked
good length, blocked into the off side
touch short, 139kph and worked down to the leg side
fullish on the stumps, Bairstow turns the ball towards midwicket

huge shout from Cummins, bringing the ball back sharply to smash into the pads... Erasmus declines the appeal but, after a fair amount of discussion, Smith decides to review. Looked like he might have been across outside off, plus height may be an issue with the WACA bounce - but let's see. No bat involved, so it's on to Hawk-Eye: which has impact 'umpire's call' and the ball going over the stumps. So Malan survives and Australia lose a review
testing line again, fading in from wide of the stumps, left alone
length outside off, 136kph and poked cautiously behind square
hammered in short and soaring through to smack the keeper's gloves
comes across and defends a back-of-a-length ball, 135kph and tapped square
fullish, targeting that tricky zone, Malan gets into it and defends to mid-on
flighted, over the wicket and spinning in, worked around the corner and they trot one
smoothly done, Malan skips down and laces a drive to the long-on boundary - and like Stoneman, he's got a new Test best today, too
floated up a touch wider and punched to cover
tossed up worked into a gap on the leg side
flighted on off, Malan covers the line and pushes back to the bowler
tossed up and met coming forwards for one more down the ground to long-off
pitched up and defended on off stump
short and slashed, room to swing the arms and Malan gleefully steers it past gully, in the air but out of reach of the diving Khawaja
length, 137kph but slightly wide and he leaves alone
pitched up and driven with a flourish to the cover sweeper
banged in short, snaking bouncer but Bairstow avoids being bitten as he leans back
pitched up and clouted towards cover, half-stopped on the dive and they think better of chancing a run
slides on with the arm from round the wicket, defended to cover
uses his feet, gets to the pitch, flicks just to the left of mid-on and that brings up the century stand
deep in the crease and tucks this off his hip round the corner
lovely drive from Malan, big stride forward into a full, widish ball and flays it along the ground through the covers
full and straight, pushed to mid-on
fraction shorter, allows him to play back and tuck it through square leg...nice placement brings a second
slotted through the off side, a gentle delivery wide outside off, driven on the up
dropped in short, on middle, swivels on a pull down to long leg
nearly dragged on! Plays forward to a length ball, bat isn't quite straight, takes a thick inside edge into his boot which then bobbles past off stump
defended towards point
full on middle and leg, clipped to deep square
short of a length at off stump, defended
hint of turn, takes a thick inside edge behind square on the leg side
fuller, outside off, flicked with bottom hand to the off side
flicked wide of short leg, he didn't quite keep this down
nice footwork, skips down the pitch and flicks down to long-on
full outside off, eased through the covers and wide enough of the sweeper to make a comfortable second
full at middle and leg, flicked to midwicket
played off the back foot to cover
short outside off, left alone
short of a length, a bottom-handed whip through square leg
short outside off, in good control, over the top of the bounce with an open face to guide through backward point
comes forward and again drives on the up, finds point this time
full and straight, flicked to short midwicket
driven down to long-off
wider line outside off, he plays and taps with an open face into point
smart batting, pushes a length ball square into the off side to rotate the strike
defended to the on side
fuller at off stump, he stretches forward and defends
bottom hand comes into play again and works down the ground
short outside leg stump, tucked behind square
nearly an edge! Short, wide outside off, a half-hearted cut and almost a top edge
in control this time, cuts firmly behind point, work for the man at deep cover
fuller, defended coming forward
full toss which he can't take advantage of, drives to mid-off
gets across outside off and works into the midwicket
full and straight, driven to mid-on
short of a length, worked to midwicket
that's a lovely piece of touch, a length ball at off stump, he opens the face and guides it between slip and gully to bring up his fifty. Probably the best thing to happy to JB in Perth so far
a short ball, he sways out of the line
nearly through him! A yorker almost does the job, a hint of late shape into the toes, Bairstow just manages to get the toe end of the bat on it
worked off the pads to long leg
full at leg stump, driven firmly back to Smith
turned off the pads behind square
nice line and length, on off stump, defended on the front foot
a well controlled late dab from Malan, fully in control, wide of slip towards third man. Starc does well to chase it down. Malan into the 90s
good line, touch wider outside off, draws Bairstow forward, defended with an open face wide of slip
plays back to a straighter delivery, worked off the pads into square leg
length ball at off stump, defended to cover
fuller, at the stumps, driven to mid-on
back of a length, straight, tucked to midwicket
a bouncer, 84mph/135kph, which he ducks
back of a length at off stump, on his toes, punched to mid-off
another short one, outside off, he drops his hands and lets it through
very full, dug out back to the bowler
plenty of air, dips a little as it reaches Malan, driven to cover
pushed to mid-off
full at off stump, skids on a touch, defended from the crease
a little wider, brings him forward as he drives to cover
tossed very wide outside off, Malan reaches a long way for it and the ball skews off a thick inside edge as the bat twists in his hands
full and straight, driven to mid-on
full outside leg stump, Bairstow flicks it neatly down to fine leg. Poor delivery
back onto off stump, punched to mid-off
a short ball over middle and leg, he ducks
length ball on the stumps, worked to midwicket
another short one, doesn't quite up, travels over Bairstow's back
dropped! In the slips. Full outside off, some late swing, Malan driving with a closed face and it bursts through third slip, Bancroft, as he dived across
pushed down the leg side at 88mph/141kph
good ball, length pushed across outside off, Bairstow's feet don't move and feels for it away from his body. Things already happening with the newy
another outside edge! This one flies down to third man. A full delivery, at the stumps, Bairstow aims to work it through the leg side and the it skims wide of gully. Not a chance
more uncertainty! Reached for a full ball outside off, takes a thick inside edge into his boot
full, straight, late swing, driven into the off side...that was a lively first over with the new ball
round the wicket, pushed down the leg side, diving take from Paine
an aborted appeal for lbw, nips back from short of a length, takes him high on the pad and the angle also working against him
full outside off, left alone, climbs through to the keeper
top shot! In the slot outside off, very full, Malan onto the front foot and drives beautifully through the covers
pulls the length back a bit, driven to point
short, down the leg side, Malan swings at a pull and doesn't make contact
defended to mid-off
length ball, straight, nudged towards mid-on and a well-judged single to bring up the 150 stand
full toss on the pads, just a single as he clips it straight to long leg
lovely shot! Full at off stump, searching for the swing, pinged wide of mid-off with a perfect off-drive
that's loose! Short outside off, climbs over the top edge as he aims to play square through the off side
wild again from Bairstow, needs to control himself, chases a full one this time outside off without any footwork
gets inside the line of a back-of-a-length ball and plays to midwicket

there it is! A maiden century for Malan. Gets it with a pull, rolls his wrists, sends it to ground and picks the gap to deep square leg. A top innings, gutsy and counter-attacking when he needed to be
full outside off, left alone...now he needs to start again. Control those emotions
over the wicket, full outside off, onto the front foot and drives exquisitely through the covers...a trademark for the day for Malan
very full, at the popping crease, defended
short over leg stump, through to the keeper
full outside leg, jumps from the footmarks and more work for Paine
pushed across outside off, left alone
length at off stump, defended
appeal for lbw as this shapes back on a full length and takes the pad, but did it pitch in line? No review from Smith. May have done too much as well
aims for the yorker, it's a low full toss at off stump, skims off a thick outside edge between third slip and gully
full outside leg, flicked behind square. Bairstow quick between the wickets. That's the 300 for England
round the wicket, down the leg side
full outside off, defended to mid-off
played to mid-off
banged in short of a length, Malan on the back foot and defends
length outside off, he's back and across as he defends to cover
bouncer over off stump, he ducks
full outside off, Bairstow reaching away from his body and gets an inside edge into the leg side
round the wicket, full outside off, left alone
full at off stump, bat and pad together, solidly defended to cover
a short ball, he drops his gloves and arches out of the line
that's a beauty! Full at off stump, eased straight of mid-off with a text-book perfect drive
a bouncer over off stump, ducks underneath
short of a length, outside off, left alone
full outside off, good delivery, Bairstow comes forward and defends to point
that's a good 'un! Back of a length outside off, climbs past the outside edge to Paine
well-judged leave, on length as much as line, in fact think it carried over off stump in the end
goes full and straight, delivered from wide on the crease, flicked to square leg
good length ball at the stumps, takes a thick inside edge into the pads and bobbles towards the slips
unleashes a low full toss to begin with, Malan bunts it back to the bowler
in the channel, 139kph and holding its line as the batsman comes forward and leaves
goes full, looking for the in-ducker I think, Malan drives but the bat seemed to turn in the hands and it dribbles to cover
straighter line, up to 143kph now, calmly tapped towards midwicket
sung down the leg side, Paine has to throw himself across to prevent byes
finishes with a bumper, over the stumps and over the crouching Malan - a maiden to start the day
fullish around off, pushed back towards the bowler as YJB comes across
pitched up, 134kph and driven, Bairstow coming forwards again, Hazlewood stretches down to field
touch shorter, wide of the off stump and left alone
back of a length, good areas and climbing through, there's that exaggerated bounce as YJB plays inside the line
length ball, 138kph outside off, gets in a stride and leaves
full and driven, nicely struck but mid-off flies across to his right and cuts the ball off - maiden for Hazlewood, tight start
oof, not far from playing on! Pitched up and Malan prods at it, thick-edged into his pads and it wheechs past leg stump
length, 143kph and pushed down into the off side

crashing into the pads, Malan stuck on the crease... Erasmus shakes his head, Starc looks anguished! Was it sliding down? Australia go for the review, though it seems more in hope than expectation; yes, replays quickly show that Malan was standing on leg, it hit him just about in line, but would have missed the timbers according to Hawk-Eye - so Australia lose their second review, and they won't get them back, either
good length in the corridor, comes across and leaves alone
slips in another full bunger, this one is right on line, maybe a touch of swing too, but Malan gets bat in the way
pitched up, 142kph outside off and driven without timing - another maiden, three in a row this morning
pitched full outside off and it's driven towards extra cover
length ball, YJB comes across on off stump and leaves
tight line, this is disciplined stuff so far, Bairstow remains patient as he shoulders arms
banged in short now and he ducks underneath
back of a length, 134kph and defended down square on off stump
sliding into the pads, is the opportunity for England to get going...? No, it deflects of the pad and square leg tidies up
back of a length, searing through in the channel as Malan throws his hands up
fired in straight and turned square, again there's a fielder in the way. They're like magnets this morning
a run! Starc slings down another attempted toe-crusher but this swings a touch down the leg side and Malan glances to fine leg, to get the scoreboard creaking into life in the fifth over of the day
length ball, 142kph and this takes off on its way past the batsman, Paine clinging on to an exocet above his head
touch fuller, swerving menacingly on middle and leg, thuds into the pads - but Bairstow had got some bat on it
full on the stumps again, nicely played coming half forwards but mid-on slides to stop the drive and prevent any more additions to the total
round the wicket, short of a length over the stumps and Malan turns it off his hip for another single
spanked through the covers, Bairstow splutters into life now, fractionally overpitched and dispatched to the rope for the first time today
comes across and taps a length ball away
fired in straighter, YJB clips it towards midwicket
teasing line, this climbs to hit the outside edge, quite high on the bat but softly played and it bounces well short of third slip
good carry through but the line is wide enough for Bairstow to leave confidently
lets go a full toss and he leans out to bunt through the covers, using the pace on the ball and the pace of the outfield, Malan ticking now, too
length, sliding down the leg side as he moves across
good-length ball, 143kph outside off, Malan moves into line and leaves
chin music from Starc, drop the needle on the gramophone! Malan ducks nonchalantly
slightly wide of the stumps, nothing doing
ooh, good yorker, Malan does well to squeeze it out - would have crashed into middle and leg otherwise
banged in short but sliding down the leg side, Malan pulls out of his half-hearted cross-batted shot... and I think Smith appealed for a caught behind? Odd
back of a length in the channel and flying through
banged in on off stump, good pace at 140kph but Malan presents the face of the bat in defence
length, climbing through outside off, no need to play at it
dug in, Malan seems a little late on the pull but manages to get it away safely through midwicket for a couple
full outside off, tempts the drive and Malan flays elegantly through the covers, came off the toe of the bat, I think, and it's just another brace
back of a length, 136kph, defended on off stump
lovely stroke, not all that full from Cummins but he steps across and times it beautifully on the up, outruns the fielder to the rope
oh, creamed, four more! Regal stuff, YJB gets forward and rattles an even more punishing drive through extra cover
banged in short, slightly leg side and ignored
back of a length,137kph and defended staying back
banged in and blocked stoically in front of off stump
full and shaping in, clipped off the legs
fullish length, looking for a bit of wobble with the 17-over ball, defended
full but too straight and Bairstow whips a couple wide of fine leg
good length, bit of shape away as he leaves
pitched up, 129kph and that's a floaty leg-stump half-volley, which he connects with well to pick up four to deep backward square
holding its line on off, comes across and defends
short outside off, drops back to defend
probing in the channel, touch short and wide and he's able to leave
full and wide, not much to worry about when the ball isn't swinging and Malan carves it away to deep backward point, four more
short and it evades everyone, Paine can't prevent a couple of byes
slammed in short and this flies through well over the crouching Malan, Paine has to stretch every sinew to take it with his fingertips
short, wide and crunched for another boundary! Malan is opening up as he dispatches a cut
smashed through the off side, Bairstow stands tall in the crease and rasps four more - he's within a shot of his century now
sliding in a touch straight, worked away and he races back for a second, on to 99 as England pass 350...
short ball, that's well directed, YJB crouches and lets it go
pitched up and clipped to square leg, no run there

there it is! Takes the short ball and swings it down to fine leg, Bairstow has his fourth Test hundred and first in the Ashes! An immaculate knock, fully justifying his promotion to No6, and it's helped put England well on top
short and wide and Malan slashes it away through gully for four more. Australia's earlier parsimony a distant memory now
shortish and defended on off stump
touch back of a length and blocked from the crease again
digs in the short ball, Bairstow ducks
shortish, 140kph outside off and he shows it the bat face
tigher from Cummins this over, YJB comes across and defends
bangs down another short one and YJB is quickly down out of the way
Lyon dangles this up outside off, full enough for the drive. Malan caresses it through the covers
much shorter and outside off, Malan now goes on the back and chops it out to deep point
around the wicket, on the pads, turned through midwicket
full and straight, played back to Lyon
Malan dances out, the bowler drags it short on the stumps, punched to long-on
faster, flatter, angling across off, blocked back to the bowler
lifter outside off, Malan ponders about a hook, but belatedly decides to let it pass
another short ball, angling in towards the throat of Malan. He has his eyes locked on it before swaying his upper body out of the way
back of a length and largely holds its line outside off, crisply punched on the up to cover
back of a length and homing into the hips, camps back and manoeuvres it to midwicket
back of a length and a bit too straight in line, allowing YJB to flick a single down to long leg
Cummins gets it to zip from the deck and rise at Malan, he, however, rides the bounce and cautiously fends it out to point
pushed through on off, defended with the break to forward short leg
thigh-high short ball on off, YJB swats it off the back foot to deep midwicket
tossed on middle, not much turn, forward and defended back to Lyon
straight ball, pushed back to Lyon again
sliding into the pads as Malan wanders down the track and secures a single with a push to the left of mid-on
tossed up on middle and leg, whipped with the wrists to deep midwicket
predictably, he sends down a short on on leg, YJB ducks under it
back of a length on middle, he stands tall and punches through the vacant spaces at midwicket
bouncer angling away on off - or just outside off - Bairstow slips under it
yet another short ball on middle, Bairstow ducks again
dug down leg, the batsman sneaks inside the line and lets it go
banged down leg, Bairstow is aware of the threat posed by the bounce and leg slip, and leaves it be
slower offbreak, starts outside off and turns away, left alone
pushed through outside off, overspin and extra bounce, Malan jabs at a cut and the bat hits the splice/handle and bobbles back down the pitch
forward and taped to cover
tossed outside off, blocked to the covers again

It takes a terrific catch from the sub fielder - Handscomb - to end a terrific stand. Malan dares to step out and hit against the break over wide mid-on/midwicket. He is nowhere close to the pitch of this offbreak and ends up skewing it to backward point, where Handscomb judges it expertly and completes a sprawling catch - horizontal to the ground. The fifth-wicket stand ends at 237 - 18 shy of the all-time record for England
sprayed on the pads, glanced fine on the leg side
feisty bouncer, ducks under it

Just like that Australia have plucked out two wickets in four balls! Cummins runs in hard, hits the pitch harder, and bounces out Moeen. This one bursts from a back of a length outside off, Moeen stays leg side of the ball and has a flirt at it. He winds up gloving it behind to Smith at wide-ish second slip
dug in on middle, sails over the left shoulder of Woakes to the keeper
back of a length, hurtles in to ping the glove and wander away to the right of short leg
shortish and down leg, Woakes gets out of the way
Cummins has Woakes hopping and skipping. He rushes the batsman for pace and forces him to fend to leg
good length and outside off, no shot
full and hung up wide outside off - wider than a set of stumps outside off - Bairstow flashes an outside edge past second slip. The ball streaks away to the third-man boundary
back of a length and wide outside off, Bairstow stabs at it and is beaten again, watching the ball bounce over the bat
banged down leg, he gets inside the line and lets it go
pitched up and outside off, presses out and dabs to cover
back of a length and width, Bairstow latches onto it and chops it hard onto the ground, sending the ball skipping over Lyon at point
rising ball outside off, Woakes rises with it and pats it down
back of a length and arrowed down leg, the batsman shuffles inside the line but does not make contact with a glance
Woakes splices an outside edge to the third-man boundary. Short and climbs outside off, Woakes has a crack at it and sends it flying past the right of second slip
follows the short stuff with a much fuller ball. Woakes is concentrating as his assured footwork suggests. He presses right forward to negotiate it
and now Cummins pushes him back with a short ball on middle. Fended away to the leg side
short on middle, boings off the deck and flies into the gloves of Paine as the batsman rocks his head out of the way
dug in short and angling in just a shade outside off, YJB bails out of the hook
back of a length on off, punched off the front foot to cover
back of a length and straighter in line, tucked to deep midwicket
pitched up and outside off, right up Woakes' alley. He leans out and creams a drive through the covers. So easy on the eye

Cummins runs in from long leg dives forward to snap up a smart catch. Good change-up from Hazlewood: he follows up a very full ball with a shorter one on the hips. Woakes shapes for a flick-pull but ends up flapping a catch to the man in the deep. Make that three wickets in five overs
dug in on middle, Overton camps back and fends it off
good length ball on middle, he covers up in defence

Starc returns and floors the middle stump. This is pretty full - not quite a yorker - and jags back in. Bairstow aims for a leg-side flick, but doesn't account for the inward movement. The ball takes the inside edge and rattles the stumps. England have lost four wickets in six overs. Nonetheless, excellent innings from YJB
short and angling away, has Broad hopping, and fending wide of short leg
pitched up and outside off, tentatively pushed through the covers
back of a length, bounces, and screams away. The batsman tucks his bat inside the line
back of a length and skidding across off, Overton tucks his bat inside the line and lets it go again
more sweet-chin music, shuffles across off and prods it wide of short leg. Think it did not carry to Bancroft there
chest-high short ball on middle, Broad hops and fends it down
glanced in the air but to the left of a diving Bancroft at short leg
rising short ball outside off, patted down to cover
short and homing in at the head of Overton, he avoids it
Fire and brimstone at the WACA! Accurate short ball, just over the chest, Overton sits back and aims to fend it off. Instead, he only loops it off the glove to Bancroft under the helmet short leg
back of a length, angling away from over the wicket, ducking away past the outside edge

Broad backs away outside leg and exposes all three stumps. Starc goes outside off, Broad hits it over the top. Lifted over extra cover. Lyon chases, Broad takes three and exposes Jimmy to Starc. Not a great idea from Broad
ooooh, Jimmy shuffles across off and nearly fends it back onto his stumps. Short, curving away, he fends it just wide as the ball trickles square past the leg stump
Anderson wanders across off, Starc sprays it down leg, past the bat
Anderson moves across off even before Starc delivers. Short and outside leg, left alone
head-hunting short ball, angling away, Anderson yanks his head away
Broad slinks outside leg, uppercuts and misses, as this one soars over the stumps

Broad has a big yahooooo at it and sends the ball sailing past square leg and the score past 400. He steps away outside leg and swings it over the boundary. Was it top edged? Broad would say he nailed Hazlewood over the fence
Broad takes on the short ball and hooks away to long leg
dug short and down leg, Anderson, having ventured across off, runs it away fine. Paine dives to his right and makes another superb stop
Anderson keeps moving across off, he misses the glance, and the ball bounces over leg stump
low full-toss on off, jabbed back to the bowler
Starc bounces out Broad and wraps up England for 403. Broad ventures a long way across the off stump and aims to hook it over to long leg. Instead, he cue-ends a catch to forward short leg
Anderson whirs in and hits a length, straightening a touch, 128kph and defended solidly coming forwards
length, in the channel and Bancroft watches it closely, leaves
some movement, 131kph as Bancroft brings the bat down at an angle, clips the outer half and runs square, he's alert to the opportunity for one
shaping in on middle. 134kph and Warner defends his first ball
pushed across the bows, good length and nibbling away, shoulders arms
touch short of a length, 132kph outside off, Warner dabs to point - 'Waiting!'
banged in a touch short, over the top of off and Bancroft defends from the crease
sliding down the leg side, 135kph and he misses out with a flick across the line
slightly wide of the stumps, either-or length as Bancroft comes across and elects to leave
Broad drops short, 137kph and it stays very low, passing the crouching Bancroft at head height before bouncing into Bairstow's shins
this one poings through off a length, touching 140kph as zipping through as Bancroft raises the bat out of the way
dug in short, he ducks the bouncer
pushed through on off stump, Warner lines it up
nibbling away, oooh... just past the edge! Gets Warner groping down the wrong line, into the keeper's gloves
touch short, 134kph and blocked going back on middle and off
good length on the stumps and Warner squares up to block with muscular intent
tight around the line of off, not there to drive and he pushes towards cover
excellent length, 134kph on off stump, not much swing and it's watchfully blocked to the off side
good carry, length in the channel, left alone
pitched up, 138kph and gets him driving, played without timing into the covers, there's one on offer in front of square and they hustle through
around the wicket, fired in on off stump and punched defensively to mid-off
good length, 137kph and he dabs square, into the gap and scurries through for his first run
short of a length, nicely worked from off stump towards mid-on for one
angled in on the body, Warner squirts a single through midwicket, Anderson chases it down
pitched up and driven, Anderson throws himself to the ground and gets a hand on it as Bancroft whirls for his ground... Gaffaney happy that the bat was in
pitched up, 134kph a few inches outside off, blocked firmly into the covers
pitched up again and this time Warner crunches through the line, gets it past mid-off and away for the first boundary of the innings
drops short and there's no mucking about as Warner belts a pull... but Moeen does terrific work a midwicket to prevent another certain four
good areas, 136kph/84mph around off stump, Bancroft pushes at it and gets a thick inside edge through square for a couple
jumps back and across and shoulders arms to a shortish ball outside off
more runs for Warner, cut with power off the back foot but the man at deep point does well running around
good length, 138kph from Broad, no sideways movement and it's stunned down square for another easy one
fullish length, comes forward on off stump, prodded into the covers for another well-run single
ooh, nearly sneaks through, played late into the ground as the ball seams a touch in line with off, bounces past Bairstow and they take one more
oh, beautifully done, the on drive, barely any follow through but the ball rockets away out of the middle, fine of mid-on for his first four
back to probing in the channel, 138kph and Bancroft leaves alone
short on the body, nudged to leg off the back foot for one
pitched up and straightening a touch, again the bat comes down at an angle and he edges a drive but it's short of third slip... Nowhere near carrying
plays this from the crease, soft hands and dabbed into the covers
too straight, swinging a touch, 136kph and taken off the pads through square, there's a sweeper out there
pushed into the right-hander, short again and worked to deep backward square
slanted across on a length and steered through backward point
whizzing through, 139kph outside off, not tight enough to the stumps to draw a stroke
good length, met with a firm front-foot block
full, slightly wide, brings out the drive but it's duffed without power to mid-off
ooh, nicely bowled but well played as well, 140kph and rising in the channel, he doesn't go hard at it and just steers the ball wide of slip for four to vacant third man
touch full, again met on the front foot and pushed into the covers
straighter line, Bancroft plays around his front pad and taps to mid-on
slightly back of a length, 135kph and Warner defends from the crease on off
short, tries to tuck off the body, that Achilles leg-side jab of Warner's, hits the under edge and rebounds back towards the bowler
good hands from Warner, stabbing a length ball between point and cover
banged in, 135kph and rising outside off, blocked
full and there's a hint of swing, driven into the ground coming forwards, Woakes grabs it in his follow through
pounds the ball in short, flying through to the keeper down the leg side as Bancroft flinches underneath it
fired in at the body, worked off the hip for one more through square leg
full, slightly floaty half-volley in the channel but Bancroft mistimes his drive to cover
dug in, 139kph and rising towards the rib cage, played well as he rides the bounce and nurdles one more to the leg side
back of a length, diligent line on fourth stump, blocked down into the on side
goes fuller, 139kph and bunted towards mid-on
tight on off stump, Warner continues to watch the ball closely and pushes back to the bowler
Woakes bangs the ball in short, climbing through high over the crouching Bancroft
good length, 136kph hung out a few inches wide of off stump, no stroke
back of a length again, pretty good line but again the batsman doesn't need to play, so doesn't
trampoline bounce for Woakes, the bouncer clears Bairstow, although I think he got a glove-tip on it... Alastair Cook then lumbers effectively after it and prevents it going for four byes
angled in, flicked in the air but safely down to fine leg
good length, 137kph and Warner chops through the covers, they think about two but the deep fielder keeps them honest
starts round the wicket, gentle pace, 126kph outside off and Warner punches one more through the covers
oof, close to the off stump, some nip back for Overton as Bancroft leaves
goes short, 130kph bouncer, he continues to duck those
back of a length, angled in and worked down to fine leg for a single
banged in and this rears back at Warner as he tries to uppercut, fails to get anything on it
good length, punched towards cover from off stump
good running, comes across and dabs a length ball into the covers
shot and thumped, a cross-batted cleave through the covers, maybe came off the toe as Anderson manages to chase it down before the rope
drops the bouncer, 136kph and he's happy to duck and cover
full and driven crisply but Woakes gets a hand on it and deflects it wide of the non-striker's stumps
back of a length, slightly wide and left alone
short again, Bancroft gets out of the way comfortably enough
back of a length and outside off, Warner could have left that alone. Instead, he jabs at it and edges it between slips and gully. Gully throws himself to his right to (half)stop the ball

Overton finds the outside edge again, Bairstow snaffles it. Good length, angling in towards off stump from around the wicket, then straightens away a touch. This is much closer to off stump and has Warner pinned to the crease. He jabs at it and nicks it off
fuller than a good length, angling in, but does not threaten off. Ignored

Overton throws himself to his left from his followthrough and nearly pulls off a belting return catch. Good length and angling in on middle, Khawaja aims a leg-side shot and spoons a leading edge to the left of the bowler. Overton tumbles, sticks out his left hand, but the  ball does not stick
pretty full and scoots through outside off, left alone, the ball dies on its way to the keeper
pretty full and seams back in, drives off an inside edge. The ball trickles down to mid-on
back of a length and holds its line outside off, firmly punched on the up to short cover
similar length on the stumps, punched back
short on the leg stump, ducks under it
Ooooh, the ball skips away to the boundary like a pebble on water. Simply gorgeous. Fractionally overpitched, Bancroft stretches out and plays a textbook cover drive
full and straight, worked away to mid-on
bouncer, aimed at the head of Khawaja, but he comfortably ducks underneath
excellent length from Overton. He needs to do this often. Good length, angling, snaps off a crack and breaks away outside off past the outside edge
back of a length and angling into off, Khawaja presses forward and dabs to catching midwicket
full and angling in on off and middle, Khawaja prefers to hang back and clip a single to the left of midwicket
overpitched on the pads, a whirl of the wrists sends the ball through the vacant spaces at midwicket
hip-high short ball outside off, swivel-pulled out to deep square
pretty full on off stump, forward and driven to mid-off
good length on middle, turned straight to short midwicket
full and straight, picked off in the gap between short midwicket and mid-on
good length and holds its line outside off, no shot
shorter and on a fourth-stump line, fended back
wide of the crease, homing in on the hips, deflected to fine leg
full and nibbling through the corridor, left alone

Overton spins around for an lbw appeal. Erasmus shoots it down. England challenge the on-field call. Sharp nip-backer from Overton, fuller; Bancroft plays around his front pad and misses the ball. There's a noise - he smacked his bat onto the pad. No bat on ball. Impact in line and that's crashing into the middle stump. Two for Overton in three overs. Root pumps fist and celebrates after his review proves sucessful
full and nipping in at off, prodded past the cordon off an outside edge
shorter and outside off, the batsman evades it
overpitched and outside off, Smith lays into it and crunches a drive to the left of short cover
Smith shuffles across off, picks it from off stump and twirls it to long leg
good length and angling in on off, worked to short midwicket
Smith ventures across off and lets this full one go outside off
much shorter and outside off, Smith ducks under it
pitched further up on off, Smith runs it to backward point with soft hands
Smith rises on top of this short ball outside off and deliciously punches it past the left of short cover
good response from Overton. Length ball, kicks up at off, squares 'em up and glances the glove
nice and full on off, pushed down to mid-on
just short of a good length and slanting in on middle, Khawaja rides the bounce and blocks to short midwicket
good length and he explores the corridor, ignored
tight line on off, played back to him
full on off, check-driven to short cover
hip-high short ball on middle, swivel pulled to long leg
proper bouncer on middle, forces Smith to get under it
slides in on off, no turn, defended back
tossed up and dips on leg stump, Khawaja stretches out and paddles it fine
tossed up again, drifts in, poked back off an inside edge
slower through the air on middle, forward and smothered
Khawaja stays leg side of this full ball on middle and stabs to cover
full and goes on straight, defended back to him
fractionally overpitched on off stump, Smith eases forward and languidly drives it past the left of the bowler
full and zipping through but does not threaten off, Smith leaves it be
Smith gets on top of this short ball outside off and punches through the covers. <s>Bancroft</s> Khawaja slips at the non-striker's end on the second. So, it's just two
tapped back down the pitch to mid-on
full and angling in on off, Smith deploys a short stride and plays it back
Smith shuffles across and works this length ball on middle to short midwicket
skidding into leg stump, blocked off the back foot to short leg
tossed on middle, defended
floated up full, hint of drift, defended back
fired into middle, defended again
tossed on middle, driven to short cover off the front foot
full on middle, played back to Moeen
full and angling in on middle, Smith merrily clips past short midwicket
wide of the crease and Overton gets it to hold its line outside off, left alone
length ball jumps at off stump, Khawaja does well to loosen his grip and fend it off
Khawaja goes back to this short ball on off and turns it to short midwicket
half-volley outside off, Khawaja reaches out for the ball with his hands and flays it through the line to extra cover, where Anderson dives to his right and fumbles
banged short and outside off, rolls his wrists and pulls to long leg
Khawaja dares to cut off the stumps. Manages to chop off the back foot to cover
looped up on off, forward and dead batted
Khawaja blocks a shortish one off the back foot
tossed on middle, defended back to the bowler
full and drifts into Khawaja's forward defensive
looped up slower and higher outside off, drilled straight to extra cover
back of a length on middle, clipped out to short midwicket
overpitched and outside off, Overton cops punishment. Smith stretches out and spanks this half-volley to the cover boundary
glanced off the hips to Moeen at long leg
bouncer, angled in, Smith has his eyed locked it before ducking under it
follows it with another bouncer, Smith evades it again

What a brute of a ball to cap the session. Good length, explodes from the pitch, smacks the thumb and bounces onto the grille of the helmet as Smith looks away. He then manages to stop the ball from tricking back into the stumps
sliding in and defended down towards short leg
tossed up and pushed back to the bowler. 'Very good, Moeen bhai,' yells Bairstow
drags this ball down and Khawaja doesn't miss out, stepping away to club through midwicket
flighted, gets forward to drive, nicely struck but mid-off scampers across to cut the ball off
over the wicket to Smith, who goes back and across and French crickets a shot into the body of short leg
flat outside off, stands tall and punches one to the cover sweeper to keep the strike
back of a length, rising outside off and pushed into the cover-point region
bumper, he hooks in the air... and nails it into the crowd! Well over the head of Moeen at fine leg, Broad holds his hands up to his face - he thought he had him for a moment. Nope
comes across and defends back down the track
full outside off, driven and there's more runs here - or one, at least, as mid-off makes a good move across to his left
round the wicket, holding its line a touch, Khawaja edges the ball low towards gully
short and wide and cracked through point on the cut, went of the bat with a report that rung around the ground
tossed up and he drives, comes off the inside half of the bat
goes back and across and drives through the covers
floated up and defended on off
very full, dips a bit as he jams the toe of the bat on it
slower and drifting in as Khawaja gets on to the front foot and defends
gets another good stride in and smothers the ball as it goes on with the arm
short and wide and guided through gully, Smith rolls on at more than a run a ball - always in control, not a great line from Broad
length, comes across and defends
slightly straighter, worked into the leg side
oof, that's smoked down the ground, on drive to a full ball... but mid-on is set back and cuts it off on the dive, went so quickly they couldn't take one, either
defended into the ground, back to the bowler... who then tries to throw at the stumps with Smith hopping back, to boos around the ground. Erasmus tells Broad to calm down
Smith gets across on off
tossed up and pushed back down the track
darted in and Khawaja taps it away
flighted, he gets Khawaja driving and it takes the edge but flies wide of slip for four!
tossed up and pushed into the off side coming forwards
oh, beats the outside edge as he tries to cut! Close to the off stump as well, hands on heads among the England fielders... Khawaja still looking a little wobbly against spin
full around off, comes forward and meets it with a straight bat
angled in, good length and turned to the leg side
short, zipping through in the corridor, Smith elects to leave
full and tailing in as Smith spanks another straight drive back past the stumps - but that mid-on is well placed and against prevents a run
length, 134kph over middle and off, defended from the crease
goes very full, 136kph and aiming for middle stump, Smith calmly clips it off his toes but straight to backward square leg
slightly full, fourth-stump line, Smith jams the bat down in defence now - maiden over, good little battle between these two
stays round the wicket, tossed up and pushed away
uses the feet, driven into the covers and he finds a gap to get off strike
over the wicket, Smith waits on the back foot and pushes to long-on
angled in, stays in the crease and taps the ball away
floated up on off, Khawaja lines it up in defence well enough
full, flighted and calmly prodded back down the track
Broad continues bowling straight, nudged to the leg side but can't get it through
tight line, 132kph in the channel, Smith walks across like a gladiator with his weapon raised but then lets it go
full, not quite the yorker and it ends up being a pat-a-cake half-volley on middle and leg that Smith sends screaming through midwicket
touch leg side, maybe flicked the pads, doesn't carry through to Bairstow
short, shoots through low... but somehow Smith manages to wrangle it away for four more! Sort of a short-arm jab, keeping his eye on the ball and times it past midwicket again
good length outside off, 136kph and Smith leaves this be
round the wicket, angled in and defended on off
good length, fourth-stump line and Khawaja prods it back down the track
in the channel, 129kph and holding its line a fraction, lets this one go
tighter to off stump, touch short and blocked from the crease
probing, slightly back of a length, not much in the way of nibble and Khawaja jumps into line and blocks again
length ball, 133kph on off, tapped into the covers... Anderson returns with a maiden
shortish, Smith plays back and punches a drive to cover
