good line, 137kph and this brings some indecision from Smith, finds the edge but he keeps it down and Root can only get fingertips on it as the ball bounces wide of second slip
full around off, touching 141kph as Khawaja defends stoutly
line and length, defended on off stump
off-stump line, comes across and taps the ball away

leaving the batsman, who fishes and gets a thick edge... but it flies through the cordon for four! Root seemed to be unsighted at second slip, moving the wrong way and he threw up his hand too late. Big chance, extra pace and bounce for Woakes but England fail to take advantage
pitched up, Smith drives powerfully into the covers, where it is half-stopped
round the wicket, full and blocked coming across
diligent probing around off stump, 130kph and Khawaja defends again
pitched up, 137kph as he bends his back, clipped along the carpet to mid-off
digs the ball in, gets up towards chest height but Khawaja rides it well and fends one through square on the leg side
over the wicket, goes full around off, 136kph and defended back towards Anderson
in the corridor, 140kph as Woakes tries to recreate the opening from his previous over, Khawaja leaves
slightly short and again he can watch it through wide of the stumps
dug in and Khawaja pulls now, bottom-edged down past his stumps and they trot the single
fuller to Smith, 138kph and around off stump as the batsman defends
fired in straighter and tucked to the leg side
full outside off and Smith pounces, rattling a drive between mid-off and cover that races away to the rope - and that's his fifty, from a spruce 58 balls. He's in the groove again
defended into the off side
good length, 136kph whistling through in the corridor, no stroke
touch short around off and Khawaja hangs back to block
pitched up, a touch wider and he draws the drive, Khawaja is seeing it pretty well now, too, but picks out extra cover on the bounce
over the wicket, hint of seam and bounce as Khawaja gets a bit front on, manages to keep it down
length on off, 133kph and blocked back to the bowler... who does a little keepy-uppy and then frowns the frown of a frustrated fast bowler
short outside off, 137kph and punched to extra cover on the back foot
full in the channel and left alone
good length, 137kph as Smith comes across and again decides not to play
length, good line just outside off, Smith thinks about playing and then leaves again
drops short outside off and he plays at this, mistimed into the covers
full and wide, Smith doesn't bother giving it a second glance... but England at least succeed in tying him down for an over
pitched up and angled across, Khawaja leans out and sniffs the air, no stroke
moves across on off and taps the ball down towards point
good length, flying through outside off as Khawaja leaves
oh, done him, nibbles away past the edge and into the gloves...! Bairstow thought he had nicked it, but Anderson knew otherwise, offers just a lugubrious glance at the batsman
full and wide and left alone, maybe a cutter
pitched up in the channel, Khawaja is back to well-judged circumpsection
angled in and left alone in the channel
short of a length, 136kph and swatted away through the covers, there's a man out in the deep
on the stumps, not giving anything away, Uzzie blocks
short, wide and given the treatment, Khawaja is up on his toes and simply caresses the ball through backward point for four
goes round the wicket, 136kph back of a length and defended to leg
fullish and left alone in the corridor
tries to sneak one through full and straight, Smith chops down on it in time
full, maybe a touch of reverse as Smith covers his stumps and prods back towards the bowler
length outside off, Smith gets across and defends
fullish on a fourth-stump line, 139kph and hinting at away swing, defended solidly into the covers
pitched up and driven, taken from outside off and it rolls towards mid-on
and there's a cover-driven four to cap off the over, lovely free-flowing stroke from Smith. Don't ask what Anderson thought of it
oh, nicely played, full and straight from Woakes and Khawaja leans on it, clipping gracefully through square for four more
still round the wicket, 135kph and back of a length, left alone
moves into line and lets it go again
pitched up and driven to cover coming forwards
very full, almost a full toss but wide of the stumps and Khawaja squeezes down on it
length ball, taking the pace off a touch, defended on off stump
angled in on off stump, Smith defends softly
on the stumps, tapped down to the leg side
slightly back of a length, worked down towards square leg
Smith leans on to the front foot and lets the ball go
touch short, driven off the back foot but can't get it through the cover ring
straighter, defended on the hip to midwicket
round the wicket, full at off stump, pushed back to the bowler
touch wider, full outside off, left alone
shorter, defended on the back foot to the off side
pushed up fuller outside off, Khawaja across the crease and plays to the covers
latches onto a pull from outside off, excellent fielding at midwicket to intercept one-handed and save the boundary
another short one and Smith is able to find the gap, swivels on an easy pull and sends it wide of square leg
full at off stump, 80mph/128kph, defended to cover
fuller still, he comes forward and drives on the walk to mid-off
defends a length delivery to the on side
tight on middle and off, defended to the on side...a miserly spell, but England need a wicket
driven straight of mid-off, Broad is able to get across, and that brings up the century stand
short and wide outside off, Smith carves it through the covers from the back foot
short from round the wicket, he ducks
short on the hip, bit of a gift, Khawaja rolls his wrists and pulls it away very fine
another short one, this is outside off, he gets across the crease and pulls wide of leg gully...Overton is down in his follow through
short outside off, not much pace, Smith gets on his toes and square drives through point
short at the body, 84mph/135kph, pulled to long leg...Overton not moving freely
round the wicket, full at off stump, worked to midwicket
poor start, short outside off, rocks onto the back foot and drives through the covers wide of the sweeper
hint of a leading edge as he looks to work this from outside off to the leg side
shorter, flatter, defended on the back foot
fuller, he stretches forward and defends
full and straight, flicks across the front pad and places it wide of the deep midwicket
defended on off stump
round the wicket, good line and length, just outside off, Khawaja a little in two minds whether to play or leave
across outside off, works a length ball to the leg side, a suggestion this kept a little low
drives a full ball into the covers
back of a length, worked from outside off to the leg side
goes for the yorker, it's a good one, almost squeezes through but Khawaja manages to get the toe end on it. Was actually an off-cutter
full outside off, defended to cover, a tidy maiden
full outside off, goes for an expansive drive, thickish inside edge to the leg side
lovely placement from Smith, takes advantage of width from Moeen, steps back, opens the face and guides it fine of backward point
full and straight, defended
bottom-handed flick down the ground
round the wicket, drives a full delivery into the covers and takes him to a half-century
flicked into midwicket

he's been given lbw! Khawaja has called for the review. Could height save him? Round the wicket, beats the inside edge, takes the back leg, very top of the pad flap. Looks like it touched the front pad first. Or is it an edge? Was given on-field, remember, so evidence has to be conclusive to change the decision. A lot of rock-and-rolling from the third umpire. Now they've gone to the tracker and it's umpire's call on impact and height!
full outside off, brings him forward, defended to cover
back of a length outside off, left alone
full at off stump, he's right across the crease and works to the leg side
left alone outside off
a strangled appeal this time! He got a long way across to a full, straight delivery, missed his flick to the leg side but ball was angled down
full at off stump, defended into the leg side
good length outside off, defended to cover
fuller outside off, firmly driven wide of short cover and Broad does well to cut it off
angled into the pads, finds square leg
short of a length outside off, driven off the back foot to deep cover
good length at off stump, squared up a little as he defends
very full at off stump, driven to cover
full and straight, meat and drink, flick effortlessly wide of square leg
this time he slots an on-drive sweetly off the middle but finds mid-on
full, he's right across outside off, defends to mid-on
angled in at off stump from wider on the crease, defended
full outside off, a slightly slower ball, driven to mid-off
defended square to point
full at off stump, strides forward and plays to mid-off
hint of late movement on a full length, turns Marsh round a little as he defends
short of a length, angled across outside off, left alone
back of a length, played square into the off side
good line, full at middle and off, Marsh almost loses his balance as he plays slightly across his front pad
too straight, worked off the pads behind square although England won't mind the chance to bowl at Marsh
round the wicket, short outside off, pushed to the covers
fuller, outside off, a rather extravagant leave from Marsh
and he's off the mark...ah, not he isn't, it's leg byes. Angled into the pads, takes the thigh pad wide of a diving Bairstow
back outside off stump, left alone
full at off stump, plays with the angle into him and clips to midwicket
back of a length at off stump, defended
full, driven to deep cover
over the wicket, full outside off, and this time he's definitely off the mark as this slides off the face wide of gully
drags the length back, on off stump, defended to cover
worked into the leg side
full and straight, pushed back down the pitch, Anderson gets his right hand to it
full outside off, that pinged off the middle to cover
on the popping crease, wide of off stump, pushed square through point
works off his pads to deep midwicket
full from round the wicket, defended to cover
round the wicket, very full at off stump, driven to mid-on
gets too straight this time, neatly worked off the pads through midwicket
round the wicket, full and straight, blocked
more air, he uses his feet and clips firmly to mid-on
full, driven back to the bowler

was that a chance?! Marsh clipped it towards short leg and it ballooned up, Bairstow tried to take the rebound. Yes, it bounced off Vince's boot. Both got a hand to the rebound and neither could hold it! That would have been out
on off stump, defended
tapped to the off side
full, wide outside off, harmless and left alone
gets across to a straight delivery and flicks to backward square leg
length outside off, defended to cover
gets forward and drives to mid-off
full at off stump, 82mph/132kph, defended to cover
good running, pushes towards mid-off and spots the chance straightaway. Means he keeps the strike which will frustrate England
flicked from off stump towards mid-on who is deep enough to allow the run
shorter, whipped off the back foot and finds square leg
fuller, slower, defended on the front foot
tapped into the leg side
carefully plays a full ball back to the bowler
touch shorter, Marsh onto the back foot and pushes firmly down the pitch
short of a length, touch of extra bounce, Smith takes his bottom hand off the bat
a bouncer outside off, Smith sways out of the line
full at off stump, defended to mid-on
another bouncer, wide of off stump, no threat to miss who happily watches it go through
full and straight, pushed to the covers where the fielders are a little on their heels
round the wicket, full outside off, pushed firmly to mid-off
runs in, hits the pitch short of a length on off, Smith crabs across and defends
angled in, targeting the stumps again, touch short and worked down to square leg
pitched up, 135kph around off stump, Smith defends calmly and precisely back down the track
fired in full on leg stump, flicked down to fine leg - polite applause for the first run of the day
full and angled across outside off stump, steps out and waves it through
pitched up, closer to the stumps, Marsh prods in front of square and wants one but is sent back as cover hares in to field
goes full and wide, not sure if that was part of the plan, Smith cracks it through backward point from the crease, finds the sweeper
full, tailing into the pads from round the wicket, clipped firmly towards the deep midwicket rope for three
good length, 136kph and blocked coming forwards on off
in the channel outside off, lets this one go
length, better consistency from Broad, tapped into the covers
angled in and Smith blocks once again
tight around off stump, straightening a touch, Marsh defends
on the stumps, shows it a straight bat again
full length, 131kph and shaping in a little as Marsh pushes a drive to mid-on
dug in, this springs up at Marsh like an excited Labrador and hits up near the bat handle as he plays back
tight around off stump, Marsh prods it away
good lines, draws him forward and then gets it to fishtail away... but he judges it well and lifts the bat out of the way at the last moment

slower through the air, clipped off the inside half of the bat for one to short fine
fullish in the channel, prodded away towards cover by Marsh
short and wide and mullered past backward point, in the air but that went like a rocket, four more as he reaches the brink of 150
full and driven, cracked straight to mid-off

ooh, some extra lift for Woakes, finds the shoulder of the bat but it loops safely well short of gully and they jog through, brings up Marsh's 150 - another wave of the bat to friends, family and well-wishers, on we go
angled in and helped away to the leg side
short of a length, 129kph and Marsh blocks resolutely on off stump
tossed up on leg and nurdled around the corner again
pushed through flat on leg stump, clipped square to the fielder
flighted, on the stumps and he defends from the crease
touch short, muscled into the covers but it is well stopped and they prevent a run
floated up full, Marsh goes for the heave down the ground, think it was off the inside edge but it flies towards Moeen along the ground, he stops it calmly
full and flighted, Marsh back to defending
short outside off, Smith chops it somewhat wearily towards cover-point
dug in, 132kph around off stump, defended wachfully down to the off side
comes across and defends, Smith looking just a wee bit sapped now
back of a length, rising up in the channel and he steers towards backward point - 'No!'
slips in the attempted yorker, Smith is still alert enough to drop his bat on it
shortish on off and Smith is again happy to defend, concedes a maiden to his downtrodden opponent
floated up from round the wicket, Marsh steps out to defend
pushed across on off and tapped into the covers
flung out wide and Marsh extends the arms to give it some humpty over cover, there's no one out there and he slaps in the air without a care
pushed through on middle and leg, knocked back to the bowler

tossed up and he pushes at it stiffly, almost a caught-and-bowled chance... but it didn't quite carry to Moeen, going low to his right! Not far from the close fielder there, too, but England's wait goes on
tossed up full and worked towards square leg
full of a length, in the channel and he drives, picks up a couple through cover - raising the Aussie 500 in the process, still only four down and looking imperious
touch wide, Smith throws the hands and slashes to point on the bounce
length on off, Smith gets into line and defends
angled in straight and he taps it back defensively
some inward movement, maybe a touch of reverse - or it hit a crack? - Smith takes it on the thigh as he plays the wrong line
pitched up, 135kph and punched to mid-on
outside off, chopped firmly out to backward point
good length, outside off, turning away a touch, punched off the back foot
flicked into the leg side for another single
looped tantalisingly onto a good length and blocked
fully forward, and defended back down the pitch
decent length, if a touch lollipoppish... pushed cautiously to mid-on. A tidy over
flicked out to deep square leg. Smith looked to be getting a bit of a massage during the drinks break, but no sign of his running easing off
swinging into the pads, and flicked uppishly into the leg side
up on the toes, punched to cover
too straight, flicked out to the leg side once again. Such ease and confidence in his strokeplay
banged in short, and ducked
short, and utterly crunched out through deep midwicket, a front-foot flog, and excellently hauled in by the diving Woakes. That was travelling
looped up on a good length, a Hales-lite action, but marginally less ragged
worked to the leg side with a hint of inside edge. Probing...
stretching onto the front foot and blocked back to the bowler
faster, flatter, sliding into the pads, and worked to leg
onto the front foot, pushed to cover
slow and teasing, threatening to turn, every ball a potential insult to a well-set batsman. But no mistakes just yet...
dangled outside off stump and cautiously blocked back down the pitch
defended on the back foot with a slightly circumspect block, bat away from body
just a suspicion of reverse swing as Anderson aims fuller and is fended away on the crease by a very watchful blade
full again from Anderson but too full this time, clipped into the leg side with insouciance
defended once again from a full length
head over the ball to block to cover
fully forward to defend
forward and into the off side
good tidy areas from the loopy leggie
giving it a rip, as this one zips on straight. Good flight and purchase
areas, Dawid, areas. He's looking England's likeliest threat at the moment...
back of a length, tapped to point. Good bowling
tight line, good length, solid block
outside off, and driven hard into the deep.
square-driven formidably! A valiant dive on the rope but no joy. Broad's 100 comes up
flogged through square leg! That sat up and begged, like a scene from Lady and the Tramp. This is ominous
onto the front foot, and blocked to cover
full and straight, attacking the stumps. Stout defence
forward to block
nudged to the leg side
on the pads, nudged into the leg side
tossed up and blocked back down the pitch. Malan still probing
picks the gap with perfection, through the covers with effortless footwork and timing. And that equals Smith's highest score
opens the face and finds another gap in the covers, and there's a new zenith for Test cricket's brightest current star
outside off, full length, pushed to the off side
outside off, pushed into the covers. Calm and in control
on the pads, worked behind square, easy pickings
line and length. Hang it there all day. Just wide of off stump on a good length, and duly blocked
driven on the up, into the covers
whipped with authority out through the leg side, a tired half-volley, and England's suffering shows no sign of abating
pops up off the deck, back towards the bowler, and just short! A momentary lapse from Smith, but one that will surely redouble his concentration...
flipped to the leg side
a tumbling stop from Anderson at mid-on to intercept
big stride onto the front foot, no way through there
tidy delivery, bouncing from a good length and punched to point
flicked up and into the leg side
whipped off the toes, out to square leg
tidy line and length, defended on the back foot
no rush from Smith as he presses into the off side
back foot, and blocked
clipped on the up, down to long-on
angled bat, defended to third man
on the pads, whipped round the corner
driven with a closed face past the bowler, gathered at mid-on
bit of drift, bit of bite... threatening! (Sort of...)
width, slapped to deep point. On they grind
outside off, and fenced to point
up on the toes, driven to cover
defended again
driven hard into the covers
flicked firmly to square leg
leaning forward, indomitably blocked
on the legs, square leg is back in business
deflected off the pads once more. It's a holding pattern, nothing more, nothing less. Not sure what England have got left to hold on to, though
on the back foot, blocked back to the bowler
full length, attacking the toes, chiselled to the leg side
patted back down the pitch
tight line, good length. Blocked
full again, attacking the toes. Blocked back down the pitch
on the back foot, squeezed into the off side, and picked up at point
round the wicket, blocked from a good length
outside off, cracked with all the time in the world, through the covers for another gimme boundary
on the toes, clipped up and into the leg side
open face, angled down through third man
Marsh hands the strike straight back
a further exchange of singles, and there's one over to go
stretching forward, blocked to the off side
on the hip, tucked fine, and there is the 300-run stand! Stunning application, and oodles more to come tomorrow, you suspect...
tight line and length, a slower ball from Woakes, Watched all the way onto the bat
on the pads, whipped hard into the leg side
back-foot block. One ball to go ...
squared up a touch on the back foot. And stoutly blocked
straight one to start off, at a length. Defended comfortably on the back foot

it looks like Anderson has trapped him right in front of middle stump. It's been given. It's also been reviewed. Slightly fuller length ball from the last one, nips back in a touch. Marsh sitting on the back foot and he's beaten on the inside edge. The reviews shows no edge...and tracking tells us that's clipping the top of the stumps for what will remain an umpire's call and that is an abrupt end to Marsh's innings
back of a length and in the channel, defended away from the body, into the pitch off the inside half
nicely pushed wide of mid-off. Bit of movement away from Anderson, at a full length outside off. Paine leans into it for his first run
length and in at off stump, defended own the pitch
back of a length at middle stump, defended on the back foot
back of a length, in at off stump on the angle. Defended off the back foot
wide of the crease, length ball angled in at off stump. Defended on the front foot
back of a length, off stump defended on the back foot
digs one in short, but it's too wide. Paine sways away
back of a length at off stump, defended on the back foot
bouncer angled down leg side, gets under it comfortably as he ducks

here we go. The first Smith flick of the day. A length ball, angled into the pads. Stands tall, whips it past square leg who is a tad slow getting down to his left. Deep midwicket fetches from the boundary
length at middle stump, defended down the pitch
full and into the pads, clipped from the crease. Moeen Ali gets down quickly at square leg this time, to his left, and keeps it to one
full and in at leg stump, can't get bat on the attempted flick, cops it on the pad
some shape for Anderson again. Tails away from off stump on a length, defended solidly on the front foot

hello! Whew! Looks like that one's lifted off a crack. Completely beats Paine who is set up solidly on the front foot with the full face of the bat pointing down the pitch, only to see it zip away from him like a legbreak
length at off stump, defended on the back foot
back of a length in the corridor, walks into it and is slightly cramped, but he gets right on top and taps it through the wide open gully area
back of a length, in at leg stump and climbing. Gets on top of it and dabs to fine leg
good length, angled into the corridor. Defended on the front foot
fuller, just outside off stump. Defended into the covers
bouncer, too short. Lets it fly over his front shoulder

another review. Smith is hit on the pad in front of middle, just like Marsh. There were a couple of sounds. Umpire's said not out...there's no bat on the replay. And ball tracking says that's hitting! Decision overturned. A good review from England. Anderson was unsure, because of the sounds I reckon. Smith was playing down the wrong line as this one straightened from a middle stump line. He was right back in the crease as he is wont to do. England hitting the right spots this morning. Smith's highest score will read 239. An epic ends
back of a length, slanted across off stump. Poked into the covers on the up
length at middle stump, bunted uppishly towards short midwicket
and it turns out that man is a catching fielder too. One that Starc almost finds. Lifts this length ball on the up, and it lands short
full, swinging in at leg stump. Inside edge and onto the pad as his head falls over during the attempted flick

oh dear Starc has messed this one up. Paine's blinded - he's just taken a big inswinger on the pad as he's looked to flick. It's flown towards gully as England make the appeal. Starc's called for the run, then realised there's no chance. Paine's halfway down when he gets the call for no. A bit of an empty stare between the batsmen before Starc decides it'll be him who takes the fall. England have a mere walk to clip the stumps at the striker's end
nearly another run out. At the non-striker's this time. Paine drops this length ball in the gully region and takes off. The fielder can't hit the stumps
beaten on the outside edge. Angled in at the corridor, draws the bat out and then zips past it
it's moving now. Full outswinger just outside off. Hardly any feet as he pokes this to mid-off
length ball in the corridor. Defends from the crease, inside the line. Outside edge fizzes to first slip on the bounce
full at off stump, defended on the front foot
bouncer at middle stump, gets well under that as he ducks
good length outside off, defended from the crease
oh yes. Anderson's well and truly in right now. Length ball in the corridor, shapes away very late and Paine withdraws the bat at the last moment
length at off stump, drops it into the covers with soft hands
inswinger, at off stump stump on a length. Defended on the back foot
length and shaping away outside off, left alone
good length, swinging in at leg stump. Pushed to midwicket on the up
full outside off, bit of wobble as Paine jabs at this well in front of his body. Drives to mid-off
good length at off stump, defended solidly on the back foot
full at leg stump, flicked straight to short midwicket. No movement on that one
shot. A stylish pull shot, fetching it from wide outside off. But he finds backward square leg
full at off stump, tapped to mid-off on the front foot
good length at middle stump, defended to mid-on from the crease
good length at middle stump, pushed to midwicket
misfield at backward point. Stoneman lets one through as Cummins gets a thick outside edge on this length ball outside off
short and wide outside off, gets under it, slices very elegantly through backward point
length at the stumps, defended down the pitch
full and swinging away outside off, defended on the front foot
Paine about three yards down the pitch. Walks into the length ball after starting outside the crease. Covers for the bounce, pokes it to cover's left with soft hands and steals the single
good length at off stump, defended into the covers with an open face
full and into the pads, clipped wide of fine leg
back of a length at middle stump, defended on the back foot
good length outside off, big stride forward to push this to cover's left
back of a length at middle stump defended into the leg side
back of a length at middle, defended down the pitch
back of a length at off stump, defended on the back foot

looks very plumb as Paine cops this in front of middle stump, just above the knee roll. It's been given. He's reviewed it. He has been batting well outside the crease. If anything saves him it'll be that. There's no edge...and it's missing! Big stride, helped by where he started this shot, helps him make that review straight away. This is swinging in and climbing over leg stump. Good review
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
short and wide, slight nip away from the pitch. Slashes at it and is beaten
probing. Length at off stump, defended gingerly on the back foot
back of a length just outside off, climbs on top of this and tucks it neatly on the up through the covers
full at off stump, defended towards mid-off
full and swinging in outside off, driven on the up to extra cover
takes his eyes off this as it climbs up on him in the corridor. Awkwardly bunts it pitchside
full inswinger at leg stump, clipped with nice timing, but he finds square leg
watches this short one a little better. It's at a middle stump line and he ducks rapidly
good length at middle stump, defended to mid-on
back of a length outside off, leas in and dabs it wide of the sweeper left with soft hands
length outside off, opens the face and makes that strategic push to sweeper's left again to steal the second
good length, in at leg stump. Flicked to midwicket on the up
good length at off stump, defended to mid-off on the up
good length at off stump, tapped into the covers with soft hands to steal the single
outside edge to an inswinger that keeps low. Nothing about that ball was friendly to the batsman. Could have had him out three ways as he pushed forward, but its four through the slip cordon
dug in and Paine whirls on a pull, controlled it well for one to fine leg
length, touch wide of the stumps, Cummins moves across and lets it go
shortish outside off, 132kph and Cummins chops down into the off side
comes across and leaves in the channel again
dug in, decent bouncer from Woakes, the batsman clambers down into his bunker
line and length around fifth stump, again he's happy to leave them be
length, cushioned down into the covers, Malan swoops on it and throws down the stumps at the non-striker's end... but Paine had called 'NO' early and Cummins got back
around off stump, tapped away square
goodish length on fourth stump and steered behind point
off-stump line, maybe straightening a touch and Paine shows it a straight bat
full, 131kph and he drives, Broad fields in his follow through
rising outside off, a touch short and Paine is able to open the face, neatly dabbed down to third man for four
decent length outside off, Cummins lets it go
banged in short, 131kph and climbing through, ducked
ooh, this stays down, Cummins prods at it outside off and gets a scrape off the toe of the bat, bobbles through to the keeper
full and he gets forward to drive, not timed and it rolls to mid-off
hits a length and this leaps at Cummins, wide on the crease and then nipping past the shoulder of the bat as he goes at it
fired in and tapped back to the on side - that's a maiden
probing, maybe nibbling away in the channel, left alone
criminy, that's gone like legbreak! Hits the surface and pongos away from Paine as he plays tentatively forward -miles away from hitting it but no batsman wants to see that
leg side, this goes straight on and flies for byes... or did it touch the pad? No chance to the keeper, either way

pitched up, finds the outside edge... but it flies through vacant first slip for four! Another despairing dive from Bairstow, genuine thick edge but Cook is stood wide and neither was getting close to it
angled in and tapped back towards mid-on
whoosh, past the bat again, just a soupcon of nip off the surface this time as Paine closes the face
shot outsiede off and Cummins swats it powerfully through backward point, won't quite go all the way - but it brings up the Australia 600. You don't see too many of those
length on off, Paine dabs one into the covers
sliding into the pads, he flicks through backward square and they run well for two
shot! Just a glide off the back foot but he middles it and the ball races away past backward point - and the lead goes over 200, too
draws the drive, a big booming swing from Cummins, hand off the bat as it beats him and flies through to YJB
angled in with the arm, 135kph and defended back down the track
length, on the stumps and it jumps nastily at Paine, who fends it away behind square off the glove
full, 138kph as Broad finds his rhythm, sliced on the drive down to third man
there it goes again, hits a ditch and springs away from Paine, past the forward poke
full around off, Paine blocks this one into the covers
testing line in the channel, judges it well and leave alone
fullish, shaping away as Paine gets into line and leaves once more
trundles in and hits a length outside off, Cummins guides one more to third man - 50 stand up between these two, checking England's early advance
sliding and worked off the pads
short ball, decent bumper from Overton, Cummins loses control of a hook but the top edge clears square leg and they get a couple
in the channel, big swing and a miss
fired in full, Cummins rocks back and opens the face to squeeze one to third man
good length, nicely played on the up and he pierces cover for a few more into the deep
length, poked short of the man at mid-off and they scamper through
goes straighter, touched into the leg side
length, 133kph and climbing outside off, Cummins defends into the turf
yowch, that's rearing off a short length and it takes Cummins on the elbow - maybe arm guard - and loops behind square
fullish and straight, plinked to mid-on half forward
in the channel, not a bad ball but it is struck superbly well by Paine, high elbow and placement behind the man in the deep, timing to swoon over and it screams into the ropes
round the wicket, tossed up and tapped away

flighted, slightly leg side and Cummins sweeps powerfully past short fine leg, Overton is still putting in the effort and he barrels around from deep square-ish to slide and prevent four - wholehearted stuff
floated up leg side and deflected away
pushed through, well outside leg stump and Paine sticks a pad out at it
uses the feet and clips one to long-on
tossed up full, nudged towards midwicket from the crease
Paine comes across and opens the face to punch wide of mid-off
fuller length, tails in and ricochets away to leg off bat and pads, Broad chases after it
dug in back of a length, Cummins shovels it down to fine leg
good length outside off, 132kph and holding its line, dabbed to third man
length outside off, Cummins drives sweetly square but picks out the fielder
banged in short down the leg side as he moves across and out of the way
tossed up on leg stump, nudged away
drips a little short and Paine swats a pull around the corner
flighted, Cummins sweeps and he gets it fine, nicely played as he gets just a tickle to send it for four
there she blows, rolls out the slog-sweep, into the stands for six! Connected clean as a whistle and the Doctor helped do the rest
darted leg side as Cummins goes to sweep again, misses out
touch short, cracked to fine leg with another meaty swing but they only get one - and that will be lunch
back of a length outside off, pushed to cover on the up
carved. Cummins, on a leg stump guard, moves his feet further down leg side against this wide length ball outside off. Slashes at it and gets it through cover point
short ball angling in at middle, he arches backwards to guide this to third man
back of a length and down leg side, can't get anything on the flick
good length at off stump, big stride forward to defend to mid-off
swivels to adjust nicely and place this hook exactly where he wants. It's short and steep, angling down leg side. He's under it, but the wrists are rapid as he drags it fine
hoops in to the batsman but this is too short to trouble him. Squeezed into the off side off the back foot
back of a length, in at middle stump. Defended on the back foot
back of a length, swinging down leg side and too much for both the batsman or Bairstow. The keeper does get a little something on it low to his left
full and into the pads, thuds him on the knee roll as he looks to flick
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot

we have another review for lbw. Another one that looks plumb too. It's an inswinger at middle stump, headed for leg. He looks to flick and can't get bat on it. It's given out. This is full and he hasn't moved too far forward. There is nothing to suggest and edge and ball tracking confirms this is hitting leg stump
length and into the pads as he looks to tickle this fine
back of a length down leg side, looks to swivel and pull. Beaten
back of a length at off stump, squeezed into the off side off the inside edge

oh stunning shot. Springs down the track as Broad jumps into his delivery stride, and is right on top of this length ball at leg stump. Makes himself some extra pace and slaps it on the up, to the wide long-on fence
back of a length in the channel, defended on the back foot
short and wide and moving away after pitching. Paines heaves at this and might have got eight if he'd connected
back of a length and down leg side, no bat on the attempted glance
shot Garry. A straight-drive-slog-tennis-forehand hybrid, straight over the bowler's head, to a length ball in the corridor

he's holed out and they've declared. Anderson goes full just outside off, Lyon clears the front leg and heaves for midwicket. Not quite the connection he hoped for. It's gone high and it's wobbly, but Moeen Ali is smart as he gets under it at mid-on
short and way down leg side, Cook won't go after that
back of a length on leg stump, a bit of climb. He gets on top of it and glances to fine leg
good length, very late - and very little - swing away from off stump as he strides forward. Thick outside edge dribbles wide of gully
good length at off stump, defended on the back foot
back of a length on middle stump, a hint of shape away but it skids through off the pitch. Clips it off the thigh guard to deep square
oh close. Starc goes very full, in at off stump. Cook looks like he's anticipating this to away from him. Plonks the front leg across nervously and narrowly escapes being beaten on the inside edge
short and wide. Hunting for some movement inwards, but this slants across and is left alone

and this time it's the batsman hunting for the inswinger. This hits a crack at an off stump line. He's covering his off stump and looking to defend, but it nips away and dies on the keeper after beating the outside edge
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
short ball rising in the corridor. On his toes to attempt a short-arm pull, beaten on the inside edge

got him! Elementary corridor bowling. He's taken it away from the crack, he's gotten it to rise, he's offered the pull and he's kept plugging it in. All in a span of five balls. Stoneman's thinking about a lot already and that leads to a lazy push at this length ball slanted across him. No feet, bat away from the body, taken by Paine
very late forward defence. This is in the channel too, at a length. He bunts it into the turf in the direction of the slips
full and straight again from Starc. Honing in at middle stump. Cook offers no feet as he defends very very late in front middle stump
nicely done. This is length and into the pads and the timing is exquisite on the flick. Races away to fine leg's right
back of a length and down leg side, through to the keeper
good length and shaping in to the corridor, left alone
good length at off stump. No feet once more as he closes the face and drags this wide of mid-on
back of a length at middle stump, defended on the back foot
back of a length in the corridor, lifting inwards, left alone
good length outside off, left alone on the angle
back of a length, in the corridor. Left alone
oh hits the crack. Hazlewood is dangerous on this kind of a wicket. This one stops on Cook at a middle stump line. Anxious prod, into the leg side
and now he takes it away from a similar line. Cook looks to defend on the back foot, beaten on the outside edge
length at off stump, Cook leaps to defend off the outside half
good length at off stump, defended very close to the body, into the leg side
the get-Vince ball. Full, wide, juicy outside off. He leaves it alone

beauty. The Vince-drive next ball. This is full too, but a lot closer to him outside off. He's nicely on top of it with a half-stride, lets it come on and punches with balance to get this through extra cover
back of a length, climbing outside off. Left alone
full and wobbly, just outside off. But once again, he's very close to the ball as he defends
full and shaped in to middle stump, but defended late and solidly to mid-on
back of a length in the corridor, feet rooted in the crease as he hangs the bat out in search. Beaten on the outside edge

compensates by playing slightly inside the line next ball. It is, of course, in that channel outside off. Thick outside edge threatens to run to the third man boundary but Smith sprints and keeps it in with a backhand flick
nicely timed flick, but he's found Shaun Marsh's lunge to the left at square leg. A bit of shape into the pads there
length outside off, left alone
back of a length at off stump, defended on the back foot
back of a length at off stump, defended to midwicket off the inside half
full and into the pads. Angled bat comes down late, no feet. Squeezed to fine leg. Head falling over into the off side
good length and into the pads, with the angle from wide of the crease. Easy put away. Uses the pace, uses the direction, whips it fine
angled in at the pads again, wide of the crease. Thuds into the thigh guard as he looks to flick
full outside off, driven straight to mid-off
another glorious stroke through the covers. Waits for it to arrive again, and punches this length ball frim under his eyes. Text book, etc.
full outside off, defended solidly on the front foot
back of a length skidder at off stump. Leaps up as this stays low. Pushed to mid-on
short ball outside off, drags it through midwicket with an aerial pull shot that teases mid-on but ends up beating him comfortably

lunges with his right hand out in his follow through and hangs on low! Cook's gone! As feeble as he's been all innings series. A full ball at middle stump, probably sticking into a crack. Stops on him a touch. But he's moving backwards, no weight going into the ball at all as he closes the face to push this through the leg side. Comes off the leading edge and it's a sharp catch
good length at off stump, defended solidly from the crease
back of a length outside off, left alone
back of a length in the corridor, defended on the back foot
touch short of good length on off, Vince shows it a straight bat
lines it up and blocks again
nice seam presentation, shaping a touch at low 130s kph and defended softly
in the channel outside off, Vince shoulders arms
full, 124kph and tailing in a fraction, punched firmly to mid-on who pulls off a good diving stop to prevent any runs
short outside off and that's easy to get out of the way of
Hazlewood plugs away on a demanding length, Root blocks
touch short of a length, Root cracks a back-foot punch towards cover
honing that immaculate line outside off, 138kph and deflected down towards backward point
dabbed down into the off side and Root wants one to get going, it's a footrace with Nathan Lyon, but he's home as the throw fizzes just wide of the stumps

oh, big shout for lbw! Jagging into the pads as Vince plays around it, that mischievous crack nearly doing for another batsman... heading past leg, though, thinks Erasmus and Australia don't challenge
touch shorter and wide of the stumps, Vince gets down out of the way
Marsh continues, puts the ball on Root's hip and he nudges it down to fine leg for one
length ball, comes across and taps it away
dug in but that's a pretty tame bouncer, 129kph and Vince swats it away and bisects deep square and fine leg for four
full, wobbling in a touch as he clips off his pads but straight to midwicket
full and slapped past mid-on, all timing as he rolls the wrists on it and he'll get be four more, that'sh sheckshy batting
pitched up outside off and he checks a punch into the covers
pitched up on off stump, Root covers it
length, Root presses forward, gentle push through the covers but the ball skitters and slides away as Warner throws himself after it into the rope
short of a length, rising over off as Root stays back and defends towards his toes
full and rifled to the fence, an assertive step out from Root and he pings four more
back of a length and driven off the back foot, nicely timed but straight to point
comes across and taps the ball away
short from Marsh and Vince again pulls, just one behind square
length ball, Root happy to block on off
touch back of a length, Root dabs into the covers but sends Vince back
126kph just back of a length on off, prodded to extra cover
short ball, another gentle half-tracker and Root lines it up with a flat pull, a misfield in the deep gives them four - and that's the England 50 up, too
short, chopped into the covers on the back foot
starts on a good line around off, slightly short and he defends from the crease
into the body, 135kph and worked down towards square leg
shortish, Vince blocks playing back, it bounces down a little too close to the stumps for comfort but doesn't roll back as he ushers it away
cor, lovely stroke, oozed through through the covers on the back foot, slightly angled bat but right out of the middle, gets another boundary
tighter line, 139kph and he defends down into the turf
edged but he plays with soft hands, the ball skitters low and wide of the slips and he'll get four more

edged and taken at slip, Lyon strikes with his first ball! Smith had to readjust quickly to take the catch after it flicked Paine's gloves but he holds on - still plenty going right for the captain - and Australia dance around gleefully, another failure for Root and perhaps Engand's best chance of salvation has to drag himself off the field. Root was looking to be assertive, tried to drive and got done by one going straight on
round the wicket and floated up full as Malan comes forward
pushed through outside off, Malan plays it late and well off the back foot, steered down to third man for four
drifting in and turned to the leg side
flighted, full on middle and leg, Malan leans on to a forward block
tossed up, draws a few 'ooohs' from the close fielders as Malan taps the ball down to short leg
pitched up and shaping in as Vince drives without timing
short outside off, 132kph and he rides the bounce down towards point
comes across and dabs the ball down into the off side again
short, 140kph and at the body, jabbed down to fine leg
pushed across the bows as Malan stays back and leaves
short, 139kph and tapped nonchalantly down to leg from the crease
floated up from over the wicket, Vince presses forward
ah, lovely stuff, uses the feet and spirits another crisp drive away through the covers, skipping to the rope
tossed up full and pushed into the off side
quicker action, overspin on the ball and it stays down as Vince jabs at it and thick-edges past slip
round the wicket, drifting in and tapped away
full and flighted, met on the front foot as Malan smothers any spin
back of a length, shuffles across and defends
short again, blocked down towards the turf and again he shepherds it away from his stumps
goodish length on off, shows it a straight bat
slightly straighter, 142kph from Cummins, hurried a little but he tucks to midwicket
too straight and he clips one off his pads to the deep square sweeper
short, 141kph but the pitch hasn't got as much spring in as on days one and two and Malan gets on top of it comfortably enough
pushed through on the stumps, Vince taps towards mid-on
floated up, slower and dipping outside off, gets a long stride and blocks
angled in straighter and this is chopped down to short leg on the bounce
outside off, comes forward and taps the ball safely away
floated up and defended
wide of the stumps, not much sign of turn as Vince drops back and blocks
shortish and prodded down into the off side
Malan covers the line and blocks
huge appeal to resume the hostilities! But that clearly pitched outside leg, even though it was a very full and threatening length...
similar leg-sided line, back of a length, jabbed down into the crease and safely to short leg
hint of outswing from a full length, this is good probing from Cummins
stabbed into the off side with a tight and compact back-foot block
outside off, back of a length with gentle turn. Punched with a high elbow to mid-off
a windy whoosh outside off stump! Pushed through faster and flatter and draws the stroke
a touch straighter, more topspin, full-faced defence on off stump
probing away, outside off, and defended again
looped up, Vince gets his head right over the ball to stab to short leg
squirted off a fat inside-edge, safe enough but that was a fine over, full of flight and variation
short, and wristily pulled into the leg side
drawn forward
fizzing down the leg side, and crashes into the pad flap as it bursts seemingly off a crack. That utterly flew!
wow, feel the heat! This one explodes past Vince's visor as he sways inside the line
yorker, and a speedy one. That's a fine double-whammy, but Vince is equal to the task
squared up on the back foot, walks into a defensive push back down the pitch
forward and pushed to cover
leaning out of the crease to defend again
sharp footwork to wrap his defensive stance around a middle-and-leg line
advancing to meet the (lack of) spin, met with another straight bat

tossed up this time, Lyon appears to want the caught-and-bowled! Did this come off Malan's boot and into Lyon's hands? It seems nothing more than a polite enquiry, and sure enough, there's nothing doing there. On we go
driven into the off side
attacking the stumps, defended with feet rooted in the crease
outside off, stabbed into the off side
leaning forward again, poked back down the pitch - 20 deliveries without a run for Vince
short, Vince sways inside the line. Too wide to be a threat, but good pace all the same
short and wide, and that's impressively dispatched. Standing tall on the back foot and flogged through point. Shot
whipped into the leg side where Bancroft does well at short leg to take the heat off the shot
forward and blocked back down the pitch
back of a length, tapped into the covers for another single
dancing down the track, and clipped to long-on
dabbed down to third man
forced firmly off the back foot, Vince is in his Brisbane first-innings zone. How England need him to stay in that moment!
another over seen off. Confident from Vince
full length, straight bat
fired out wide of the off stump. No stroke
tight line, blocked out to the covers
full length and loose from Malan! An inside-edge fizzes out to square leg
forward again, defended
full and wide, swinging from the hand, and Malan once again drives off the inside edge into the leg side. Starc isn't entirely on top form but he's asking some of the right questions
chiselled into the leg side
worked around the front pad
head over the ball, leaning into the covers
forward once again, and pushed down the ground
on the back foot, and beautifully caressed through the covers, like the first day your daughter meets her new pet kitten. Brings a tear to the eye
there he goes, picks the gap on the leg side to reach his second fifty of the series. And fair play, in a gruesome situation, he has played with serenity and fluency
round the wicket, head over the ball to defend
angled defence, played late, head over the ball, into the covers
squared up on the back foot
round the wicket once more, very full and nearly a leading edge as Vince closed the face at point of impact. Hazlewood gathers with a growl in his followthrough
round the wicket again, speared into the stumps, blocked to point. Again, impressive time in his defensive play
nip off the seam from a tight middle-and-off line. Solid straight bat in defence
round the wicket to the left-hander, stabbed back down the pitch
slightly leg-sided, Malan nudges off the hip with gratitude
blocked on the front foot once more
nudged into the leg side, more good footwork from the left-hander
still round the wicket, good off-stump line
aggression from Vince, and that's a tremendous strike. A well-selected slog-sweep. Rolls the wrists on contact, head over the ball. Whistles through square leg
tucked off the toes
full and threatening, but well watched on the back foot
outside off, through to the keeper
yorker-length, well dug out from round the wicket

absolute snorter! Angled in, pitched on middle, bit off the turf like a legbreak. Plucked out the timbers! Think Steyn to Vaughan at Port Elizabeth in 2004, it was a very special ball to end a valiant knock. No disgrace in getting out when well set this time for Vince. That was a beauty
going for the magic ball again, but this time it goes where the angle intended it, way down the leg side
fizzes past the edge
on the spot once more
ooh, clear signs of late swing on that ball. Hazlewood just getting it to reverse a touch
watchful in defence. As he has to be...
short and sharp! Well played by Malan, limboing out of harm's way and dropping his gloves as he does so
poked into the off side with static feet
round the wicket, blocked back down the pitch
good delivery, well played, attacking the top of the timbers from round the wicket
on the back foot, squared up in defence as Starc finds a hint of late away movement
round the wicket, targetting the toes, defended with defiance back down the pitch
round the wicket again, worked into the leg side from a full length
a fine attacking length from Starc, full and fierce
poked off the back foot to point
good shape across the left-hander, lifting off the turf and through to the keeper
round the wicket, defended on the back foot, and blocked back down the pitch
full face of the bat once again, gathered at cover
banged in short, hauled into the leg side
fired down the leg side. Wrong line but can't fault the pace or effort
tucked into the gap
speared into the toes, that's another fine and threatening delivery
beautiful balance, flicked supremely off the toes, with precisely the shot that Vince had envisaged before his off pole went tumbling
another attempted flick to leg, less firm in contact as Starc aims a touch fuller
outside off, no stroke offered
well dug out on the crease. England are waving, and drowning
a checked drive, and that has fizzed off the middle, through long-off! Shot
banged in short, and crashed through midwicket with a fluid pull. Those are two mighty strokes...
full length, defended on the crease
short again, crushed through midwicket. Perfectly nailed
short and wide, a beautiful wristy cut from Malan, who is using the grim situation to his fullest advantage. Time to have a go!
solid in defence to complete a stout over
poked out to cover
head over the ball, pushed out to the covers
back of a length, slightly leg-sided, worked off the pads
solid block
wide of off stump, squeezed into the covers
up on the toes, another tremendous strike, full face, lovely timing, all the way to the cover boundary
outside off, and left alone
solid defence
no way through as Malan defends from the crease
back of a length, seems to keep a touch low as Malan stays watchful and dabs to cover
looped up, worked into the leg side
blocked away to complete the over
hits the seam, sliding down into the pads
a bit of nibble towards the cordon this time, well watched in defence
yorker! And a big appeal as Bairstow is pinned on the toe, but that's surely swinging down
a touch of swing, but merely swing straight into the middle of Bairstow's cover drive! Another classy shot in adversity.
on the back foot, and punched to cover
squared up on the back foot, but safely poked out to gully
round the wicket, defended on the back foot
tight line outside off stump, patted back down the pitch off the back foot
bouncer on middle and leg to start, Malan sinks below it
continues to test the middle of the deck and Malan is quite happy to avoid the pesky bouncers
a third bouncer in the over - and that's one more than you're allowed in Test cricket.
keeps low! Hits a crack on a good length area outside off and decks away from Malan's poke. He wears a wry smile. What else can he do?
shortish and outside off, pushes to cover. That's one done. 69 more left. Gulp!
good to meet cha, off stump! Hazlewood tunnels under the bat, with a little help from the pitch as the ball straightens add keeps rather low after pitching.
shortish on off stump, Moeen covers it well
fine shot, leaning into the pitched up delivery and gently tapping it down the ground. Full face of the bat, coupled with a good stride forward pays dividends
full and outside off, Moeen doesn't care for it

taken at second slip?! Actually, hold fire. The umpires come together and suggest it hasn't carried with the soft signal. For Moeen, this would have been a terrible little bit of deja vu. He is once again caught in the crease against a rising ball. He pokes away from his body, gets a thick edge and goes to second slip. Smith dives forward, trying to get his fingers under the ball. He doesn't take it on the first try, but snaps up the rebound well enough. We are looking at tons of replays. And we need conclusive evidence that it has carried to overrule the on-field call, which is not-out. Aleem Dar doesn't believe he has it and Smith is utterly peeved with that decision
shortish on off stump, defends.
punches a short ball from around the wicket through the covers, and the timing is good enough to beat Warner chasing it
drops his wrists and ignores the bouncer
another bouncer - a pretty wild one, Malan has to be 10 feet tall to stand a chance of thinking about playing it
back of a length on off stump, blocks
shortish and outside off, covers the line quite well
another short ball, this one targeting the badge, Malan spurns the advance

that's probably hit a crack and soars straight at first slip! Hazlewood bangs away on a length outside off, looking to produce such moments of madness. But even he wouldn't have expected that to happen. Somewhere Harmison's saying 'Happens to the best of us, mate'
fuller delivery on off stump, blunts it well
defends a good length ball on off stump
back of a length and outside off, lets it go
that's easy. That's where he wants it - 70 overs of the ball on half-volley length outside leg. Simple little glance to the boundary
full on off stump, Malan's defence is in fine order
bouncer from around the wicket, doesn't interest Moeen
continues the barrage, Moeen ducks under it

straightens after pitching, does this short ball, and Moeen does extremely well. Doesn't commit to his shot too early, and softens his grip on the bat to make sure the ball goes straight down onto the off side
that's excellent. He's wasted a few bouncers but this is fast, and it's aimed at his rib cage. Moeen is forced into taking evasive action
short again, Moeen lets it sail over him
back of a length on off stump and Moeen's right behind it
on the pads again and Malan flicks it down to long leg
direct hit would have had Moeen! A quick single to cover soon becomes an untenable risk with Warner getting to the ball so very quickly. Turns around, flings the throw but it doesn't hit the mark
back of a length on off stump, blocks
pulls the short ball off his visor to deep midwicket
defends a shortish delivery a shade outside off
good leave! This pitches on a good length on off stump and Moeen trusts it to go on with the angle across him
firmly behind the shortish delivery on middle.
beats him for pace as the 138 kph delivery, angled into his thigh pad from around the wicket, hits the target despite Malan's attempted flick
forces him to duck this time with a short ball on middle stump. It's that awkward height too, around the chest area
decks in off the crack and pins Malan on the body. He is all set to leave the ball, considering it pitched a fair bit outside off. Ends up getting a bit of a rude shock

he's looking for that crack, snaking all the way down the pitch outside off. Malan does not let that play on his mind as he gets in line with a back of a length ball and pushes it past short leg's right
140kph, full, fast and a shade outside off, Malan plays late and glides it to point
full and outside off - and it swings into the left-hander too. Moeen does well to block it, playing as late as possible.
gets across to a shortish delivery cutting in off the deck this time. Bruised heel or not, he's still a huuuge threat. Moeen negotiates it well though, with a nudge to midwicket
big swing, into the left-hander, at 142 kph. Moeen falls over as he tries to flick and gets struck on the pad. Half an appeal for lbw, but that snakes too far
140 kph, simple plan from the scary fast bowler. Bowl full and look for swing. Moeen drives well to extra cover
lovely strike, leaning into the drive and sending the 141 kph, pitched up delivery to the right of Warner. Good dive stops any chance of runs
back of a length on off stump, blocks
tosses it up from around the wicket and Malan gets inside the line of the ball to drive back at the bowler
steps out of his crease and clips the good length ball past the left of short midwicket. 'Caaatch,' a fielder cries, but it's actually played quite well
gets him forward and defending to a fuller delivery outside off
bat in front of pad, and a long stride forward to meet the flighted delivery on middle and leg
gets to the pitch of the fullish delivery outside leg and turns it through midwicket. England doing this well. So far
full on middle, Malan keeps it out
too much swing and that's not good for a ball that is already heading down leg. Paine can't do much about that. Not at Starc's pace
huge appeal for lbw as Starc pulls off the ball he has been looking for. Full, curling in and making the batsman fall over as he flicks. There is actually too much movement for this to be out
digs out a near yorker to mid-on
back of a length and outside off, Moeen taps it to mid-off
flings down a good length ball but that slingy action he has takes the ball wider of off stump than he means to target. Moeen has a straightforward leave
big swing into Moeen, but he seems to be waiting for those. Delicious flick to long leg.
gets nicely forward to smother a good length ball on off stump
strides out of his crease to meet a flighted delivery on leg stump and clips to mid-on
pushes it through - flat and quick - on middle. Moeen moves back and he's right in line with the stumps. Has to get his bat down to survive and he does
good length ball outside off, lets it go
lovely long stride to get to the pitch of the ball and a straight bat follows through
a quicker, but fuller delivery on middle. Moeen won't be fooled by such tricks. He felt he had let England down earlier in the series. He is batting like he means to make it count now.
full on middle, Malan works it over Bancroft's left shoulder at short leg
full on off stump, Moeen is solid again
fullish on leg stump, Moeen turns it to midwicket. Good stuff. He's playing late. He's concentrating on keeping a straight bat. Backs-to-the-wall goodness
full and outside off, but as enchanting as the drive looks, it goes straight to mid-off

there's the bouncer. It's taken some time, but out it comes at 141 kph, angled into Moeen's body and keeping that leg slip and short leg in play. Good work from the batsman to avoid it. Even better work from the wicketkeeper not to
full and slides down leg. Moeen can't connect with the flick
nudges a flighted delivery on leg stump to mid-on
plonks a straight bat down on a good length delivery searching ruefully of the outside edge
gets down the pitch and turns a flighted ball on leg stump to midwicket
gets the ball to dip just enough that Moeen, looking to drive away from the body, gets a little outside edge. Goes along the ground though to point
full and outside off, defends
shimmies down the pitch for a solid defensive shot on middle
short of a length and slung from around the wicket across the left-hander. Malan leaves
gets an inside edge as he tries to drive a full length delivery. But it is tinged with some venomous inswing. Could easily have had him lbw because it pitched on middle and straightened
punches on the up the length ball outside off
a full delivery keeps rather low as it slides down leg and it sneaks past Paine diving to his right.
yorker on middle, Malan is clued in to such tactics and protects his stumps well
full on leg stump, deflects it to long leg
some turn but it is slow enough that Malan, originally looking to play down the ground, can correct his shot and glide it to backward point
good length ball on middle, keeps it out
steps out of his crease and drives in sedate fashion to long-off.
lunges forward, keep to get to the pitch of the ball on middle, as he defends
defends a tossed up delivery on off stump
forces his wrists down on the ball, which is a little flatter than the previous ones.
pitches it up on middle and Malan is able to keep it out
on the thigh pad and Malan nudges it down to long leg
fuller delivery looking for the stumps, Moeen doesn't let the happy union take place.
might be glancing off the pads to the wicketkeeper. Australia's quicks aren't getting the pace off the pitch as they did previously
peels away to the extra cover boundary. A touch too full and a bit too wide and Moeen leans into the shot, looking picture perfect
ripper! Hits the deck sharply and rags away off the seam to beat Moeen, who is standing up tall. His efforts to make contact are in vain, but the good thing is that he doesn't follow the ball.
gets down the pitch a touch too soon, allowing Lyon to shorten his length and quicken his pace. Hit on the pad while defending
turns a fuller delivery outside leg down to long leg
stays back to a good length ball and defends it well enough.

that's close... and Chris Gaffaney rules out the lbw call. There is inside edge as Moeen comes forward to defend a good length ball outside off, but is it before the ball hits the pad? Replays suggest it is so that is a top call from the ump

does him second time around! This looks a smidge quicker than the last ball, but everything else is the same. Pitches on a good length just outside off and slides on with the arm. Moeen plays for turn, gets beaten on the inside edge, struck in line with all three and walks off knowing not to review.
over the wicket, lobbed up full on off and he flicks it off his front pad for a single to deep midwicket
hits a length, looking for a little jink'n'jive off the deck, Woakes defends stoically
touch short, 136kph around off stump, jumps across and defends
slightly back of a length, 138kph outside off, jabbed down towards backward point
full and pushed into the covers, nicely timed by Woakes and it gets away from the in-fielders, Lyon does well to chase it down before the rope
dug in short, Malan continues to happily let the short ball go over his head
dug in ad the ribs, 138kph and he fends it away behind square on the leg side
floated up outside off and tapped into the covers
gives it some air, drifting in and tapped back down the track
tossed up, slightly wider and he strokes it along the carpet to extra cover
pushed through on the stumps, Malan saunters down and clips wide of Lyon but mid-on comes across
quicker ball, on the stumps and worked neatly to the left of mid-on for one
pushed trough, defended on the back foot towards gully
short and pulled, pirouettes on the spot and chops it down fine wide of the keeper... that's Malan's fifty, he is almost single-handedly keeping England in with a shout here
genuine bouncer now, really awkward line towards the armpit, he was about to take on the shot but decided against it very late and does well to get the bat and gloves out of the way
short ball, hit on the body playing back, right smack on the hip! That's going to hurt but they still scamper through
pitched up, 140kph on off stump, solidly pushed away
ooh, good ball, length and straightening a fraction off the cracks, Woakes gets squared up as the ball hits the splice of the bat
good length, firmly bunted back past the bowler but mid-on cuts it off
looped up around middle and off stump, Malan leans on his blade to block
skidding on, touch low outside off and he chops down on it
pushed back down the track
lobbed up around off stump and Malan covers the line
pushed through and steered square moving across his crease for one
four for Woakes, deftly done on the back foot, going deep and using the pace on the ball to skedaddle it wide of slip and away to the rope
length ball around off stump, defended coming across
fullish length in the channel, lets this one go
ooh, that's a teasing line, rising outside off and even the chaste Malan is tempted into a flirt
short ball, climbing high and slightly leg side, ignored
good length, 137kph aiming for the cracks, Malan chops down on it back in the crease
banged in, again too much height on the bouncer to trouble the batsman
round the wicket, Woakes comes across his stumps to defend
good length on off, shows it a straight bat
dug in, Woakes is back on off stump and defends towards his toes
bumper, 137kph but the line is unthreatening, wide of the stumps and he leaves it well alone
woof, that's the swerving toe-crusher Starc is looking for, maybe just a touch too full and Woakes manages to get a leading edge on it
slung in low, 140kph and defended moving across on off
Hazlewood probing away, defends a length ball
slanted across, back of a length and Malan shapes to pull but the ball gets big and he adjusts late, dropping the hands safely out of the way
oh, that's a jaffa, full and gets him feeling for it on middle and leg, nips across and beats the outside edge... Too good!

plays back, rapped on the pads, Hazlewood belts out an appeal... Erasmus is unmoved but Australia call for a review. Was it high? Maybe pitched outside leg...? He was deep in the crease, the ball struck pad first, then the inside edge; but crucially, it has landed outside leg stump, so he survives! Would have hit the top of off... Australia lose a review, too
length, whistling behind the pads as Malan flicks and nearly tickles through to the keeper leg side
yaargh, another beast from Hazlewood! Not much he can do about those, searing through off a length... Superb over but no reward for Australia
pitched up and me gets forward well to ping a drive through the covers, won't quite go all the way for four
length, played from the crease, poked square for a single
over the wicket to the right-hander, 136kph and leaving Woakes as he hangs back and leaves
hammered in short, down the leg side as the batsman flinches away
too straight, on the pads and Woakes eases it away crisply through midwicket for four
short ball, 138kph but not getting up all that high as Woakes jumps and fends to cover
on the stumps, worked to leg

short and leg side, Malan swishes at a pull... and gloves through to the keeper! Erasmus puts up the finger and Malan walks! What a way to go, though credit to Hazlewood for the thorough frisking he gave Malan in the previous over. Saw the leg-side half-tracker and wanted to put it away, execution was wanting and Australia move a step closer to #ReturningTheUrn
oh, beats him first ball, superb length and it darts past the outside edge as he plays without foot movement
fiendish length, 135kph and nibbling as Overton fishes at it again
hits a length, doesn't get up much as he stays in the crease and blocks
full, sliding into the pads, there's a muted appeal... but that was missing, deflected behind square and they take the leg bye
slammed in short, Overton hangs back and plays inside it
short, rising like rocket fuel, he crouches well down and almost ends up collapsing on his front... Suspect he's getting a few twinges in the chest area, at the memory of Adelaide
banged in and, well-directed at the collar bone but Overton manages to defend it down, did well there
short ball again, blocked solidly from back in the crease
full now, Overton punches an on-drive and Starc can't quite cut it off, cops it on the side of the head as the ball ricochets away for a couple of runs
round the wicket, ripping bouncer from Cummins, it's just a fraction high and Overton manages to weave out of the way again
oof, nipping in off the cracks, hits the pad above the knee roll and deflects into the leg side
fired in full and straight, creeps through a touch low but Woakes blocks it steadfastly
prodded into a gap for one - the England 200 is raised, to the enjoyment of the Barmy Army, at least
good length, aiming for middle and off stump, Overton lines it up
sliding down the leg side as he flicks and misses
fired in straight and Overton skims it off his pads for one more to fine leg

banged in and fended away, low to leg gully... but Lyon can't hold on! It actually hit him right on the tip of the fingers, looks like it ripped a nail, too. Fast chance, just above the grass, very tough
short again, this time he rides the bounce
at the body, shovelled away and over the leaping fielder at leg gully this time! Warner, I think, put in a good effort but it was well out of reach, despite the dive
bouncer from round the wicket and Woakes lets it sail over his head
another bumper, rising high and it's ignored again
length, leg side and Woakes misses with a poke as it flies through to Paine
Overton gets across on off and defends
full, 137kph and Overton reaches for it on the drive, keeps the ball down and length of bat behind the shot, it easily runs away for four
sliding down leg, 135kph through to the keeper
shot and clubbed over point, Overton taking the positive approach and he guides it up and over the fielder - four more, brings the deficit under 50

good length, straightening as Overton plays across the line - and well taken low at gully! Hazlewood has his five-for, Overton is extracted by another excellent delivery, although he helped out by closing the face, looping deflection off the shoulder of the bat and the Aussies erupt again!
good length, 139kph jumps into line and defends on middle and off
angled in and worked off the hip for one

banged in short and Broad throws up the hands, gloved through to the keeper! Make that one wicket away! That's another good bouncer, Broad pretty much raises the white flag, there was a noise as it touched the glove and Cummins gets in amongst 'em. The Ashes are almost in Australian hands once again...

dug in, nasty bouncer, strikes Anderson on the side of the head! England are being pounded into submission... Although the Australians are quickly over to check he is okay. Anderson tried to get the hands up but he wasn't quite quick enough and the ball slammed into the helmet, around the ear. Going to need a minute to compose himself
hustles in and fires the ball down halfway, Anderson is well back and fiddling at the ball, doesn't get anything on it
more short stuff, around chest height as he fends and is beaten... Cummins thought he heard an edge, but it's a lone appeal
dug in at the rubs, 138kph and turned safely down towards leg gully
good length and nipping back, clips the edge as Woakes prods - but the chance loops just wide of short leg
back of a length outside off, tapped towards point
shortish, wide of the stumps and Woakes dabs it down into the covers
over the stumps, 134kph and Woakes gets in behind it
Woakes gets across and defends
bouncer to finish, Woakes hooks blindly and top-edges over the man who's just come in... swirls away and trundles off for four. But it keeps Anderson on strike
short outside off and he jumps back, pokes it away through point, they'll get one there - Anderson up to the safe end
dug in again, Woakes sways underneath
oh, so close! Just past the outside edge as Woakes stays back, bowled across him from round the wicket and a whisker away
another bumper, he crouches underneath

round the wicket, full and looking to blast out the stumps, Woakes just manages to chop down on it

short ball, Woakes tries to ramp, but can only feather through to the keeper! Job done, England have been rumbled and Australia have reclaimed the Ashes!
